loans.name: Daisy

texts.en: Daisy is a 47-year old married woman with a child living in Rizal Avenue, Ozamis City. In order to add to the family income, she enters into a buy and sell of beauty products such as lotion, make-ups, and etc which started 4 years ago. She usually gets 10,000 per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Daisy able to buy more products such as lipstick, foundation, and etc to sell because of the money amounting of 25,000 rendered to her. She joined GDMPC this year. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more products such as lipstick, foundation, and etc to sell

loans.name: Darma Sedana Group

texts.en:
Darma Sedana Group got a third loan from MUK. With 13 members, the total loan is 19,500,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). This loan will be used to buy piglets and repair cages.

Ni Ketut, the head of the group, is using her loan to buy three superior species piglets. The price for superior pig species is currently very expensive, ranging from 400,000 - 500,000 IDR. These pigs will be maintained for five months for fattening. Ni Ketut expects that during this period, the pigs will be able to develop properly without being attacked by disease. With this effort, she has a dream of fixing her house.

loans.use: to buy three superior species piglets

loans.name: Sarun's Group

texts.en: Originally from Ratanak Mondul district of Battambang province, Sarun is 56 years old and has six children, who are staying with her and helping the family's business. Sarun grows paddy rice on 3.5 hectares and corns on 2 hectares area of farmlands. She is able to earn about 20,000 KHR per day. Like other villagers, she is faced with a drought, which affects her crop yield. This is the first loan for Sarun with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She leads other member who has been with VisionFund for three cycles. She and her member are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 and 1,200,000 KHR, respectively. As the group leader, Sarun is going to use her loan's portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income so she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou is a 37-year-old divorced woman living in a rural area in Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. She has three children (two daughters and one son); two of them are dependent on her and still in school while the other works at a garment factory. For several years, she has struggled to feed her children by farming rice on seven hectares of farmland. However, a lack of capital to support her business is still her main challenge.

Chanthou’s group consists of four members who live in the same village. Chanthou has been with VisionFund for two cycles while her group members have been with them from two to five cycles. She completely paid back her previous loans, which have helped her to improve her living. Currently, she is able to earn KHR 29,700 per day from her business. Chanthou is leading the group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,000,000 apiece. She will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland and to purchase gasoline. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income so she can improve her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Samun's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Krokor district, Samun is 45 years old. She is a widow with three sons, one of whom is still in school while the others are paid workers. As a widow, she has struggled to earn a living through farming rice on a one-hectare plot of farmland, buying chicken and palm sugar for sale and raising pigs in the backyard of her house. 

She has been in the business for twenty years, earning about 12,800 KHR per day, and from this income she is able to save about 8,000 KHR each day for the future. 

Samun’s group consists of two members and Samun is a second-cycle client, while the other is just with VisionFund this loan cycle. She has successfully used the first loan to afford to buy basic household necessities for her family and do some savings. 

Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Samun will use her portion in addition to her savings to buy a hand tractor for her business. This loan will enable her to have her own hand tractor so as to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy a hand tractor for her business.

loans.name: Saroeut

texts.en: Saroeut is a 56-year-old widow and mother of three children and lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been working as a vegetable seller in a local area for ten years. The current business earns her about 137,500 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 8,700 KHR per day. The main challenge of her business is the dropping price of vegetables. Saroeut has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for two loan cycles and completely paid back her previous loans which has helped her to repair her house. Now she is applying for a loan with VisionFund of 3,600,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to purchase a decent motorcycle to support her business (to transport the vegetables back and forth for resale). She hopes to have a good living from her current business.

loans.use: To purchase a decent motorcycle

loans.name: Thao

texts.en: Thao is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new and good quality cosmetic products to restock her store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Monorom's Group

texts.en:
Monorom lives in a rural area of Sangke district, Battambang province. She is aged 25 years and a mother of two dependent children, one daughter and one son, who are under school age. To support family's livings, she grows paddy rice while her husband works as car mechanic in a local NGO to gain additional income. She has been in this business for 3 years and is able to earn about 33,000 KHR per day. 

Monorom has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The first loan that she has successfully repaid with VisionFund has helped to better support her family's livings. Now, she is leading a group of two to request a new loan. She and her member are requesting a loan of 1,200,000 KHR and 1,400,000 KHR, respectively. She is going to use her loan portion to buy a motorbike for her husband for traveling to his workplace and also to support her business. She hopes this loan will enable her family to own a motorbike and help her husband reduce travelling times to workplace and better support the family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for the family

loans.name: Navy's Group

texts.en: Navy,age 50, is a widow mother and has three children. To earn a living, Navy works as a teacher and supplements her income by selling grocery items in her local area. She has been in this business for twenty years, earning approximately KHR 162,300 per day. However, she is able to save only KHR 10,000 per day after offsetting all daily expenses. Navy’s group consists of three female members who live in the same village of Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She is a sixth-cycle client while the other two members are second-cycle clients with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Navy will use her portion to buy more grocery items such as canned food, food ingredients, sugar, and salt for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to double her income from her current business so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resale

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
La socia Laura tiene 48 años de edad y está separada de su pareja pero tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la ciudad de Huambutio y pertenece al banco Comunal “Virgen Del Carmen De Huambutio” de la Asociación Arariwa y le va muy bien gracias a pagos puntuales de sus cuotas, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a sus hijos pues ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio pues vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería para abastecer su pequeña tienda de abarrotes y desea comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más.
 
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member Laura is 48 years old and is separated from her partner. She has two children. She lives in the city of Huambutio and belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Carmen de Huambutio" of the Asociación Arariwa. It is going very well for her thanks to her punctual repayments. 

She is an entrepreneurial and hard working woman that is moving her children forward. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells various basic products. For this opportunity she needs the loan to buy goods to supply her small grocery store. She hopes to buy bags of rice, sugar and other items. 

The member is thankful for the loan and is committed to fulfilling her payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
El comité “Emanuel, se conformo con la iniciativa de la una de las miembros, actualmente se encuentran  en el primer ciclo, con 11 integrantes.
Maria José, la presidenta del grupo, cuenta que se dedica a la peluquería y que es por medio de esto que está ayudando a su familia, su meta es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria y el día de mañana tener una gran peluquería bien equipada con todo.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, gel y demás insumos, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee “Emanuel" was brought together by the initiative of one of its members, and currently they are in their first cycle with 11 members.

Maria José, the president of the group, says that she is in the business of hairstyling and this is the way that she is helping out her family.  Her goal is to be able to continue growing as a small business owner and in the near future to have a larger salon equipped with everything.

She is asking for a loan to buy shampoo, moisturizers, creams, gel, and more items, with which she can continue working and providing a good service to her clients.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, moisturizers, creams, gel, and more items.

loans.name: Sonia Esperanza

texts.es: Sonia es casada y tiene 02 hijos aún dependientes. Al ver que los ingresos de su pareja no eran suficientes para cubrir los gastos de su familia, Sonia decide emprender un negocio, la cual trabaja conjuntamente con su hermana,  brindando servicio de cortes de cabellos, tintes y tratamiento capilares.  Los créditos que recibió de Edaprospo le han ayudado a mejorar su negocio, pues actualmente  también ofrece toda clase de  bisuterías, como aretes, pulsera, collares, y tintes para cabellos. Sonia se siente feliz con cada uno de sus logros,  gracias a ello ha podido mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Con su actual crédito seguirá invirtiendo en su negocio comprando bisuterías y tintes. Posteriormente desea independizarse y poner su propio salón de belleza.  Sonia agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito.
texts.en:
Sonia is married and has two children who are still dependent on her. Upon seeing that her partner's earnings were not sufficient to cover her family's expenses, Sonia decided to start up a business. She works it together with her sister, providing hair cuts, dyes and hair treatment services. 

The loans that she received from Edaprospo have helped her to improve her business. She now offers all types of imitation jewelry like rings, bracelets and necklaces, and hair dyes. Sonia is happy with each one of her achievements. Thanks to each she has been able to improve her family's quality of life. With this current loan she will continue investing in her business by buying imitation jewelry and dyes. Later she hopes to become independent and set up her own beauty salon. Sonia is thankful for all of the people that have made these loans possible.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and hair dyes.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is married and has 8 children, six of whom are studying. Her husband is the chief of the village. She has a kiosk in front of her home, to supply people in her village with basic goods. Isabel is requesting a $1,000 loan. With this loan, she will purchase additional supplies for her store including coffee, oil, soap, and animals. She wants her children to get a good education, open a big store, and build a good house.

loans.use: To buy coffee, oil, soap, and animals.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 36-year-old single lady and a mother of one child who is four years old. She operates a grocery store and has been running the business for three years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

She has borrowed her first KES 20,000 from KADET LTD which she intends to use to purchase more vegetables and expand her store. 

The anticipated profit will be used to pay school fees for her child. Her dreams are to improve her living standards and own her residential plot.

loans.use: to buy more stock of assorted vegetables.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.en: Dilorom is one of the successful business women in the local market. She sells dried fruits and nuts. She has developing business because she has enough experiences in this business. She also has additional income from growing onions, wheat, and corn. She has 4 children and raises them alone because she is a widow. She must work hard to provide her children with all the necessary things. She is asking for a loan to buy goods such as dried fruits and nuts to develop more business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits and nuts

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms. Robina has started an embroidery business with the help of her husband Mr. Muhammad (also in the picture above) around six years ago. She is 37 years old; she has six children. Four of them are school-going and two children are underage. She has a commitment with herself to provide a quality education to her children.   

Robina is in her second loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She has been in the business of embroidery for the last six years. She started her business at a very small level and expanded it gradually. 

In order to fast-track her business growth, she utilized financing from Kashf last year and paid all her installments on time. That loan played a vital role in her business growth by fostering new orders from clients. 

Now she needs a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase raw materials for her business, e.g., thread, embroidery needles, fabrics, etc.

Robina, with the help of her husband, is very keen to expand this business to a high level because now they have good orders and committed clients with them.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for embroidery.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida sells clothes for profits. She purchases a variety of clothes from wholesale market and sells them to her community clients to financially support her family.
Her husband does a job for a low income. Shahida has given birth to a son and a daughter. Both of them are illiterate and remain at home.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her clothes selling business. With the loan investment she will buy larger variety of clothes, which will help cut her purchasing and traveling costs and improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her clothes selling business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is from Garang, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. She is 50 years old. Maria is married and has two children. 

To make a living, Maria owns and operates a specialized retail store. Maria has been in business for 14 years and earns 6,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

In 2008, Maria joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items such as candies, Milo (a brand of malted milk), shampoo, soaps, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Sambi Ternak Group

texts.en:
Ketut lives in the village of Sumberkima, north Bali, with two of her children who are still in school. Ketut helps her husband with the family's income by running pig business in her home.  He works as a farmer.

In order to expand her business, Ketut is raising capital by joining the group Sambi Ternak.  The other members chose her as the head of the group.  They work together with MUK to get business loans for pig farmers.

With the loan of 1,5M IDR, Ketut is planning to buy four piglets with the price of 500,000 IDR each (the rest 500.000, using her own money). Although the price of feed is currently very expensive, Ketut expects the sale of four pigs would gain a satisfactory profit and can increase the income of her husband to support her family and helping her children's school fees.

In the current period, there was a decrease of the loan amount. This is because they've got enough profit from previous sales to provide capital. One group member is replaced by a new member because she was ill and could not join the group.

loans.use: To buy four piglets to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Maria Hilda

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia continua dedicandose al negocio de compra y venta de artesania y a la elaboracion de trabajos hechos en arcilla como vasijas y platos, la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia es una persona responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.


La socia solicita el credito para la compra de arcilla.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the community bank “INTI QUILLA.”  This bank is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and the department of Cusco.

She continues to be involved in buying and selling crafts and creating works made of clay like vases and plates.  The member has spent a great deal of time in this business, which is going well thanks to the hard work she puts into every day at her business.  She is a responsible person with the motivation to continue working hard for her family.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy clay.  This member is thankful for the offered loan and promises to comply with the terms of repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to buy clay.

loans.name: Mauro Juvenal

texts.es:
Nuestro socio  es el señor  Mauro, él pertenece al banco comunal “Tercer Milenio” de la Provincia de Urubamba del Cusco – Perú. Nuestro socio es cesante de educación, pero se sigue dedicando a la venta de comida rápida en su pequeño restaurante ubicado en su domicilio, en el cual vende productos como desayunos, sándwiches, tortas etc. El señor Mauro invertirá su préstamo para comprar insumos como carnes frías, café, tortas, bebidas, etc. que le permita producir  y elaborar sus productos.
Mauro agradece a  KIVA por permitirle ayudarlo con su actividad y mantenerlo siempre en actividad.
texts.en:
Our member is named Mauro, and he is a part of the community banking group “Tercer Milenio” in the province of Urubamba in Cusco, Perú.  He was laid off as an educator, but he has continued to make a living in casual food sales in the small restaurant located in his home, in which he sells products like breakfasts, sandwiches, tortas (a traditional Mexican sandwich), etc.  Mauro will invest his loan money in buying his groceries, like raw meats, coffee, torta breads, drinks, etc. which will allow him to produce and garnish his plates.

Mauro is thankful to Kiva for allowing him to help out his business and to continue maintaining his activities.

loans.use: to buy groceries like raw meats, coffee, torta breads, and drinks.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 44-year-old man and married to Fransisca, a 38-year-old lady. He has 3 children, namely: Novi, 20, graduated from High School; Frengky, 14, attending the 1st grade of Junior High School; and Sherly, 13, attending the 6th grade of Elementary School. 
	
Marthen generates income for his family by distributing gravel to the building store every two weeks. His regular work includes breaking up the stones into small pieces and delivering it to the building store. Although Marthen has been running the business for many years, the income generated is unstable and cannot fully cover all the family needs. Currently, Marthen is thinking of initiating a furniture business as he also has skills in creating furniture. Therefore, Marthen submitted a loan application to TLM and requested IDR 4,000,000. He would like to buy wood and other equipment to create furniture. Marthen hopes that his plan could be implemented.

loans.use: to buy wood and other equipment to create furniture

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy large quantities of food like bananas, potatoes, rice, and maize for resale.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is 53 years old. He is a mixed crop farmer, and he is married to Jemimah, who is also a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in the farming business for the past 15 years, with a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Eliud will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His dream is to buy two dairy cows and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Idah

texts.en: Ibu Idah is how people around her neighborhood call her. She lives in Cibubur, Jakarta’s suburban area. She owns a small shop that sells basic groceries items such as rice, flour, eggs, noodles, cooking oil, etc. Other than that, she added "Ruma Pulsa", Ruma’s airtime prepaid minute product as one of her leading items. Ibu Idah is married and has three children (2, 19 and 24 years old). It is very common in Indonesian traditional families to have more children with a big gap before the youngest child. She really hopes that her business will generate more income for the family since she still has a small child to feed and school. Ruma’s field officer tried to introduce her to Ruma’s new product called Loket Ruma. By becoming a Loket Ruma agent, Ibu Idah can generate more money because she will have more services for her customers. This Loket Ruma will make Ibu Idah become a payment point for her customers to pay household bills. Ibu Idah will need an electronic data capture (EDC) machine to create the payment transactions. This loan from Kiva will be given to her to pay the guarantee deposit money in order to own this machine. Ibu Idah hopes, with this new service product established in her small shop, people will not only buy grocery items or airtime prepaid minutes from her, but will also pay their electricity bill, buy electricity vouchers and pay phone landlines bills.

loans.use: to pay for a deposit on an electronic data capture (EDC) machine for her bill payment business

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 45 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has 3 children, 2 of whom are currently in school. For the past 5 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock dry food like rice, maize flour, and beans to use for cooking, and will help Rose to generate greater profits, which will buy more dry food like beans. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own a very big business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to stock dry food like rice, maize flour, and beans to cook for resale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 36 years old. He is from Olkalou and is married with four children who are all in school.

Julius is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a heifer and fertilizers to use on his farm.

He hopes to invest and buy a plot to build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy a heifer and fertilizers

loans.name: Zunilda

texts.es:
Zunilda es de la ciudad de Pilar, es comerciante hace tres años, es soltera y tiene un hijo. Es una persona joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora que lucha por su hijo, para poder darle todo lo que necesita a su hijo.
Zunilda tiene una pequeña despensa, con todos los insumos necesarios para el día a día, con lo cual abastece a sus vecinos y a las demás personas que van hasta su local. Su meta es tener una gran despensa para seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de lácteos, verduras, hortalizas, panificados, y demás productos para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma ofrecer una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Zunilda is from the city of Pilar, she is a merchant, and she's been single mother to her child for 3 years.  She is a young hardworking and entrepreneurial person who works in order to provide her child everything he needs. 
Zunilda has a small store with all the day-to-day necessities which stocks her neighbors and other people who stop in her store.  Her goal is to have a larger store in order to continue working and help her family.
She is soliciting the loan to purchase dairy products, vegetables, other produce, breads, and other goods to stock the business and this way be able to offer her customers a wider variety.

loans.use: to purchase dairy products, vegetables, breads, and more.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José de 22 años es un experto en la fabricación de bollos limpios: un  amasijo típico de Caribe Colombiano, que es un alimento de origen indígena a base de masa de maíz envuelta en hojas de este mismo vegetal, el cual   se cuece o sancocha en agua hirviendo y resulta ser un alimento muy saludable.  Este negocio es parte de la tradición de su madre,  quien durante 15 años se dedicó desde la terraza de su casa a producirlos, para asaderos, tiendas y otras microempresas.  José siempre ha ayudado a su madre en la venta de frituras y bollos, ambos acompañante de las comidas y muy preferidos por las familias a la hora del desayuno y durante la cena. Hace algún tiempo debió asumir él solo este negocio, pues su madre enfermó. Hoy tiene  la meta diaria  de generar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su familia, así como la de estudiar y convertirse en un profesional de bien; su sueño es hacer crecer su microempresa y generar cada vez más ingresos, pero su capital de trabajo para abordar nuevos mercados resulta insuficiente y es su mayor desafío. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos, como maíz, queso, aceite, pues planea aumentar las ventas de bollos, pastelitos de queso, empanadas abriéndose a nuevos mercados en los cuales pueda obtener clientes fijos. Con su credikiva planea multiplicar su inversión así como también su sueño de prosperidad el cual no abandona en ningún instante.
texts.en: José, at the age of 22, is an expert at making "bollos limpios," a typical dish of Caribbean Colombia. It is a food of indigenous origin based on a cornmeal dough wrapped in leaves of this same vegetable, which are cooked or boiled in water. The result is a very healthful food. This business is part of the tradition of his mother, who worked for 15 years from the patio of her home to produce them for restaurants, stores, and other small businesses. José has always helped his mother in the sale of fritters and bollos, both accompaniments of the preferred foods of families at breakfast time and during dinner. Some time ago he had to take over the business himself, since his mother became sick. Now he has the daily goal of generating enough income to sustain the family, as well as studying and becoming a good professional. His dream is to make his microbusiness grow and generate more income every day, but his working capital is insufficient to broach new markets, which is his greatest challenge.  This is why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had with Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, with which he will buy raw materials and ingredients such as corn, cheese, and oil, since he plans to increase his sales of bollos, cheese turnovers, and empanadas, opening new markets in which he can obtain regular customers. With his Kiva loan he plans to multiply his investment as well as achieve his dream of prosperity, which he won't abandon for even an instant.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and ingredients such as corn, cheese, and oil, since he plans to increase his sales of rolls, cheese turnovers, and empanadas

loans.name: Juan Felipe

texts.es: Juan Felipe de 39 años de edad, con tres hijos menores, de desempeña como agente de seguridad, este emprendedor es responsable, trabajador con ganas de superacion personal como es realizar mejoras a su vivienda para brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos, las mejoras consisten en realizar la parte de la cocina de su vivienda, del financiamiento comprara material de construccion como: zin, cemento, ladrillos, madera, cal, clavos, alfajillas, alambre, hierro, entre otros.
texts.en: Juan Felipe is 39 years old and has 3 younger children.  He works as a security guard and this entrepreneur is responsible, hard-working and has the desire to advance himself.  He would like to make home improvements in order to provide his 3 kids better living conditions.  The necessary home improvements are to finish the kitchen.  From the loan, he plans on purchasing construction materials such as: zinc, cement, bricks, wood, lime, nails, stakes, wire, and iron amongst other things.

loans.use: to purchase zinc, cement, bricks, wood, lime, nails, stakes, wire, iron, amongst others

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 16 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 16 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans un même quartier au Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Léontine Couassiba est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Léontine Couassiba est âgée de 35 ans et est mariée à un certain Philémon. Léontine Couassiba n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Léontine Couassiba vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple se partage les différentes charges de la maison. Pour contribuer aux différents besoins de la famille, Léontine Couassiba vend depuis vingt deux ans de l’huile de palme et de la farine de manioc de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins. Léontine Couassiba s’approvisionne dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Léontine Couassiba sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 16, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le prêt antérieur a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The Gbenonkpo-16 group is composed of three friends living in the same neighborhood in Benin. This is the second time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to expand their business. The group’s representative, Léontine Couassiba, is the one raising her hand in the photo. Léontine Couassiba is 35 years old and married to a certain Philémon. Léontine Couassiba never attended school. The couple has three dependent children, all in school. Léontine Couassiba lives together with her husband and children. The spouses jointly provide for various household needs. In order to contribute to the family budget, for 22 years Léontine Couassiba has been selling palm oil and manioc (cassava) flour as a street vendor. This business allows her to provide for her needs without big difficulties. Léontine Couassiba stocks up in the region. 

With the goal of meeting customer demand and increasing her sales volume and her revenues, Léontine Couassiba, together with the other members of the Gbenonkpo-16 group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. Their prior loan has been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy jugs of palm oil and manioc flour.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en: Fernanda is 32 years old, married and has four children, two of whom are in the school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk in front of her home to supply people in her village with basic goods. She will purchase additional supplies for her store with the loan including flour, oil, soap, and coffee. She has been doing this business since 2006.  She hopes that with the income, she can help her children to go to school. She wants her family to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour, oil, soap, and coffee.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en: Varduhi lives in Artashat town with her husband. The couple runs a farm where they cultivate corn and tomato, grow apricot trees and keep a grape orchard. Varduhi needs some investments to improve the land and the orchard and organize the cultivation process. With the help of this loan, she will purchase tomato seeds, medicine and fertilizer to exploit the land. Varduhi will also purchase fuel for the tractor and hire workers to help with cultivation and gathering of the harvest. These investments are important for Varduhi to keep on developing her farm and get involved in other agricultural activities in the future.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, medicine, fertilizer, fuel and hired workers

loans.name: Sari Indah Badung Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Ni Nyoman and the other members of the Sari Indah Badung group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize income. Ni Nyoman hopes that through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Ni Nyoman will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed.  She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork.  With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Ni Nyoman hopes that the increased income will enable her to pay school fees.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Bendicto Kuruk

texts.en:
Bendicto is now 28 years, still married to Naomi and now they have two children aged five and one and a half years respectively. He still operates a motorbike transport service and his business is not doing too badly as he is able to make KSHS 20,000 per month.

He is now applying for his third loan with KADET and he plans to purchase grocery goods for a new green grocery business, which his wife will be managing.

He hopes with the secondary income, he will be able to purchase another motorbike as well as educate his children to university level.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables for a new line of business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and married with two children who are between 7 and 15 years old. She purchases and sells meat. She has been in this business for two years, currently employs one person to help her and she works from 6 am to 7 pm every day of the week.

Rose has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy large quantities of meat for resale. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy a large quantities of meat for resale.

loans.name: Dilshoda

texts.en: Dilshoda is a very jolly and successful businesswoman. For more than six years, she has been busy selling children's clothes. As she is smart and clever, her business has developed year by year. Her experiences help her to be successful in business. Dilshoda is a widow and brings up her son alone. She tries to do the best for her son. She wants to develop her business but her income isn't sufficient. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for developing her business. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of children's clothing

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Jason is 51 years old, married and supports a family of five. He runs a general hardware shop and his monthly income is KES 80,000.

This is his second loan from KADET LTD and he plans to buy additional stock for his hardware shop including cement, hammers, mallets and other items. The anticipated profits will be reinvested back into the business. 

His future plan is to expand his business and open another shop in another town.

loans.use: to buy cement, hammers, mallets and other items.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 43 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Analyn has borrowed and paid 15 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns income from her restaurant.

Analyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 44 years old, married to Joseph and blessed with three children. She has been a poultry farmer for the last seven years earning a monthly income of KES 16,000. 

This is her second loan from KADET after she successfully repaid her previous loan. She plans to purchase poultry feeds and drugs for taking care of the poultry, which she will sell later when they are bigger. 

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more chickens to raise and to enlarge her farm. In the future, she plans to have better living standards.

loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her poultry

loans.name: Karanjung Indah Group

texts.en:
The Karanjung Indah group is made up of 10 women who are neighbors in the same village in Mengwi, near Denpasar, Bali. The group is seeking a loan of 30M IDR, and each member will receive 3M IDR. The group was formed out of these women’s common interest in raising pigs to supplement the family income and out of their interest in learning the best practices for pig raising. This is their first loan with MUK.

Ni Komang, age 40, is the head of the Karanjung Indah group.  She is married and has two children, aged 9 and 8 and they are both still in elementary school. Her husband earns money as a employee in a factory, but Ni Komang would like to help support her family with her pig raising business. She plans to purchase a sow and sell the piglets after two months for use as fattening pigs. With the increase in household income, she hopes to be able to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a sow.

loans.name: Boaz

texts.en:
Boaz is a 27-year-old married man with  2 year old twins. He is a young father and wants to continue to provide a good life for his children, so he chooses to work every day of the week to provide for his family.

He started his mechanic business in 2006 because of the profits that it offered and the fact that there are so many motorcycles around town. He not only repairs motorcycles, but also bicycles. Boaz finds competition a challenge and has to keep working hard to keep his clients happy.  

In the future he hopes to buy some land and open up a new branch of his business. He will use the loan of UGX 2,000,000 to purchase more hardware and parts for his repair shop.

loans.use: to buy more parts for his repair business.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson still practices farming activity and the business is doing great. This will be his third loan. He has repaid all his previous loan well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as to pay for labor costs and spraying chemicals.

In the future, Samson hopes to improve his farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Varsik

texts.en:
Varsik runs a little shop. She started this business about 4 years ago. Varsik wnts to develop her shop, for which she needs sufficient means. With the loan's help she will purchase food and offer more variety of products for her customers. This will allow Varsik to increase the sales and get more business income. 

Varsik lives with her husband, Andranik, who is involved in agriculture. He also helps to run the shop. Development of the business is important for the couple to have stable income and to have ends meet.

loans.use: to pay for food.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell for her general store business.

NWTF is relisting Cristita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Muntet

texts.en:
Muntet is forty two years old married. She has been farmer for the last five years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Munet has applied for her third loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, with which she plans to purchase more stock of milk for sale in the business. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into the business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: she plans to purchase more stock of milk for sale in the business.

loans.name: Yoeurng's Group

texts.en:
A divorce mother from a rural area located in Kror Lanh district of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, Yoeurng is 44 years old. She has one daughter who is still dependent on her. She has struggled to feed her child by running a small stall to serve breakfast in the local public school. Moreover, she supplements her family income by selling biscuits. She has been in this business for ten years, earning about 20,000 KHR per day from current business. 

She is lacking capital for running the business. This remains the main challenge for Yoerung. Yoeurng’s group consists of four members, three females and one male; she is the group leader. She is the second cycled client with Kiva’s partner, while the other three members are just the first cycled clients. 

Yoeurng has successfully used the past loan to make her living in a better condition. Yoeurng is requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR and will use her portion to buy more ingredients (i.e. rice, salt, sugar, and a bigger cooking pot) for supporting her food selling business. She hopes to gradually expand her business so as to earn more income for her family’s sake.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for supporting the food selling business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Kror Lanh district

loans.name: Tashir

texts.en:
Tashir is a successful and perfectly business woman. For more than 15 years she has been busy with selling children's shoes and has more than 10 years experience employed with Imon International organization. She is very good client. Her experiences help her to be successful in business. 

In the local market she has own selling place and many customers. Tashir is also a careful mother and a lovely wife. She has 3 children and tries to do the best for them. Her husband is worker and his income is small. He can’t help Tashir and that’s why you are the only one who can help her. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for widening her assortment. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy new kind of children's shoes.

loans.name: Kotida

texts.en:
Kotida is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Kotida has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Kotida has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Kotida hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business in town. 

Kotida is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kotida who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop ,where she sells beans, rice and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, and sugar for resale and will help Grace to generate greater profits and pay some of the school fees for her children. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to live a good life. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities like maize flour, dry beans, and sugar for resale,

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old and married with nine children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like bread, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries.

Anita has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and earns additional income from clothing sales.

Anita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like bread, sardines, soft drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is  42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Elnora has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 5  years. 

Elnora has requested a loan for PHP5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Elnora  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Elnora hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old, from Nakuru and is married with two children, aged between 27 years and seven years old.

Joseph owns a restaurant and has been operating it for the past three years. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy a variety of drinks and food ingredients like cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour to use in his restaurant.

He hopes to expand his hotel and to be able to employ many people.

loans.use: To buy a variety of drinks and food ingredients like cooking oil, wheat flour and maize flour.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and spices to re sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan  is 54 years old, a widow, and lives in the Philippines. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Susan became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Vitya

texts.en:
Vitya is involved in agriculture. He raises cows, sheep, chickens, and keeps beehives. Vitya also grows apple, pear, and walnut trees. Vitya would like to develop beekeeping by purchasing new colonies of bees. He will use the money from the loan to purchase 15 colonies of bees. This will allow Vitya to gather and sell more honey and increase his income.

Vitya lives with his wife, 21-year-old daughter, and 17-year-old son. The development of beekeeping is essential for Vitya to get additional income and sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for 15 colonies of bees.

location.town: Artabuynk village of  Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 34 years old and married, with six children. He is a wheat farmer and has been in this business for the last three years with a monthly income of KES 20,000.

Jeremiah is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD and this will facilitate him in the preparation of the farm and to purchase farm inputs.


He hopes to use the anticipated profits to expand his farm and to reinvest. His future dream is to improve the family's living standards and to educate his children.

loans.use: to pay for land tilling and to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kol's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote area of the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia, Kol is aged 36 years old and a married father of one son. To earn a living, he grows rice and raises cows, while his wife supplements the family’s income via growing cucumbers and watermelons. They have been in this business for almost ten years to support the family. 

Together with his wife, he is able to earn about approximately KHR 31,800 per day and manages to save about KHR 18,200 per day. His main challenge is the low crop yield caused by the drought. Kol has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the entire loan. The past loan has helped him to grow his cash-crops timely and to make a better living. 

In the same group, Kol and other member are seeking for a new loan in amount of 900,000 KHR and 400,000 KHR, respectively. As the leader, he will use his loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer, and to buy gasoline for pumping water for his rice field. He hopes to earn more income in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seed, and gasoline for pumping water for rice field.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Adelfa is selling snacks in their local community, like hot cakes and banana cake. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 6,000PHP to buy raw ingredients in making snacks like flour, sugar and cheese.

Adelfa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Adelfa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 

Roel has a shop that sells motor parts. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan for 5,000PHP to purchase more motor parts to re sell.

Roel has been a member of HSPFI for since 2010. In the future, Roel hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase more motor parts to re sell.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is involved in cattle-breeding. Together with her husband and sons she raises cows, sheep and chickens. Anahit would like to increase the number of cattle. She also plans to renovate the barn and create better conditions for the cattle. She will also purchase fuel to transport agricultural products. To implement all these goals Anahit has applied for this loan. 

Anahit lives with her husband, 3 sons and daughter. Icnome from agriculture is important for the family to cover the costs and to live in better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for livestock, barn renovation and fuel.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children. Nora has a food/retail shop, or sari-sari store, that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 11 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Nora has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Nora hopes to improve her business for the education of her grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Kobil

texts.en:
Kobil is very successful business man. For more than 2 years, he has been engaged in selling modern furniture. In the centre of town he has 2 shops. He has many customers and all of his customers are glad from his work. 

Kobil serves perfectly for his customers. He is one of the best clients of Imon International organization and he has a good credit history. He is as good in business as in family. He has a lovely wife. They love each other very much and haven’t had any children yet. Kobil wants to develop business, but his income doesn’t allow for it. He is asking for a loan to buy goods for widening the assortment. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy furniture for widening her assortment.

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is 47 years old, married and the father of five children. He has owned a grocery store since 1980. He sells soft drinks, juices, cheese and dairy products. 

He has 32 years of experience in this field and a deep understanding of his customers needs. His store is in a very good area with lots of customers passing by. 

It is common at all levels of this society for people to have multiple businesses, which is why Abbass also does vehicle body work. He enjoys this business and hopes to improve and expand it as much as he can by opening a suitable garage and buying all the necessary equipment. Until he can afford the capital he needs to do this, Abbass has decided to apply for a loan to buy a new van to to fix its body and sell it, which will generate additional income. 

This is his fourth loan, from Al Majmoua, a Kiva partner, after repaying his first three loans completely and on time and thereby becoming a borrower in very good standing.

Abbass is aiming to earn more profits so that he can provide a better life for his family and to open a repair garage.

loans.use: To buy a small van to make necessary maintenance to it and to sell it.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child. 

Jeanette is selling used clothes in their local community. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 4,000PHP to buy more used clothes to re sell.

Jeanette has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jeanette hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to re sell.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 49 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.

Jovelyn has a shop that sells dressed chicken. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for 7,000 to buy more dressed chicken to resell.

Jovelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to resell.

loans.name: Jesukpego 18 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUKPEGO 18 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mawunakpon Espérance est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mawunakpon Espérance est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Mawunakpon Espérance a peu fréquenté l’école. Mawunakpon Espérance est mariée à un certain Fataï. Le couple a trois enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Mawunakpon Espérance vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec  son mari les charges de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Mawunakpon Espérance vend depuis cinq ans, des friperies et des sachets de façon ambulante. Mawunakpon Espérance s’approvisionne dans sa région et dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mawunakpon Espérance sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt leur permettra certainement à hausser le niveau de leurs activités et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The Jesukpego 18 Group is made up of three women who are friends and who belong to the same lending group. This is the first time this group is seeking the financial assistance of Alidé in order to increase their business. The group's representative, named Mawunakpon Espérance, is the woman who has her hand raised in the photo.

Mawunakpon Espérance is 27 years old and lives in Benin. She has not had much education. She is married to a man named Fataï. The couple has three children, some of whom attend school and all of whom are in their care. Mawunakpon Espérance lives together with her husband and children, and sees to the household expenses with her husband.

In order to provide for the various family expenses, Mawunakpon Espérance has been working as a street vendor of second-hand clothes and sachets for five years. She gets her supplies in her area and in a town in Benin. With the goal of satisfying her clients and increasing her sales and her income, Mawunakpon Espérance, along with the other members of the group, is seeking a first loan from Alidé. This loan will certainly allow them to increase their businesses and to make more of a profit.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes and sachets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank worth KES 32,700.

loans.name: Faimah

texts.en:
Faimah is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 2 years, Faimah has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells hardware items like cement and iron sheets. 

To help expand her business, Faimah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more hardware items like iron sheets for resale, and will help Faimah to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Faimah hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build more rental houses. 

Faimah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Faimah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more hardware items like iron sheets for resale.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane used the previous loan well in that she bought fresh fruits for sale and the business doing fine. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. 

Jane will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fresh fruits for her business. She will also buy seedlings for her farm. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and start large scale farming and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for sale in her business.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has four children. All of her children go to school. She takes care of her old mother. She has a business of selling used clothes and has been in this clothing business for 6 years.  

Florence has applied for a loan of 400,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She generates additional income through hiring out her motorcycle. She moves door to door selling used clothes and sells to all categories of people on retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She is aspiring to see her business grow big so that she gets a permanent business premise and also to become wholesaler. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but has no piped water. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 35 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.

Lolita buys and sells hot dogs in their local community. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to purchase more hot dogs to re sell.

Lolita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lolita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hot dogs to re sell.

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es: Carlos Jose de 53 años de edad, casado , tiene por actividad economica una ferreteria ubicada en su casa de habitacion , en el mercado de la localidad y por encargos, tiempo de tener el negocio 10 años, dicha herramienta de trabajo la inicio con ingresos de trabajador en un taller, en la actualidad el negocio ha crecido gracias a su responsabilidad, tenacidad, ganas de superacion personal,  y el apoyo que leon 2000 y programa kiva le brindan a los pequeños comerciante para tener un medio propio de trabajo. El objectivo del prestamo es invertir en capital de trabajo como : alambre, clavos, hierro, zinc, llaves de pase, tuberias, pegas de conctato, lamparas recargarble, tornillos, desarmadores, entre otros.
texts.en: Carlos Jose is 53 years old and married. He has a hardware store located in his home, in the local market, and also by order. He’s had this business for 10 years and started it with income from working in a shop. At present, the business has grown thanks to his responsibility, desire for personal improvement, and the support that Leon 2000 and Kiva offer to the small shopkeepers so they can have their own way of supporting themselves. This loan will be used to invest in working capital, such as tie wire, nails, metal roofing, faucets, pipes, contact glue, rechargeable lamps, screws, and screwdrivers, among other items.

loans.use: to buy tie wire, nails, metal roofing, faucets, pipes, contact glue, rechargeable lamps, screws, and screwdrivers, among other items.

loans.name: Nibet

texts.es: La cliente, Nibet, es una señora de 23 años de edad, está casada con el señor Elmer Max, la cliente se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda, en donde actualmente tiene 8 cabezas de ganado lechero en producción, y la leche que produce la cliente entrega a la empresa, actualmente la cliente vive por la zona sur de la ciudad de Cochabamba, aproximadamente a 8 km de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la casa donde vive la cliente es propia y de su familia, la cliente vive con su esposo y su  hijo, el destino del nuevo crédito de la institución es para la compra de cabeza de ganado lechero, para aumentar sus ingresos  por la venta de leche, y de alguna u otra manera podrá satisfacer sus necesidades que tiene en su domicilio, es por lo cual reflejamos esta pequeña historia de la cliente, para el conocimiento de todos ustedes.
texts.en: The client, Nibet, is a 23-year-old woman. She is married to Elmer Max. Nibet’s business is making raw milk, and she currently has 8 heads of milk cows producing. She turns in the milk that she produces to the company. Currently, she lives in the southern zone of the city of Cochabamba, approximately 8km from the city of Cochabamba. The house where she lives is her and her family’s. She lives with her husband and her son. She will use the new loan from the institution to buy heads of milk cows in order to increase her income selling milk and in one way or another, she will be able to meet the needs that they have in her home. This is why we are telling this little history of the client, so that you can all know her.

loans.use: to buy milk cows.

loans.name: Victor Hugo

texts.es: EL VICTOR HUGO, es una persona de 23 años de edad de estado civil casado, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, vive en casa de sus padres, cuenta con un dependiente económico a cargo el cual es su pequeño hijo; la actividad económica principal a la que se dedica es la producción agrícola; produce papa y haba en sus propias parcelas producto de herencia y en compañía (es decir en terrenos de otra persona la misma dispone el terreno y los clientes la mano de obra y algunos insumos utilizados en la agricultura y a la cosecha el rendimiento se dividen en partes iguales), sus terrenos se hallan situadas en la comunidad de Sankayani  Bajo del municipio de Tíraque distante aproximadamente a unos 75 Km. de la ciudad de Cochabamba. Finalmente el cliente y su esposa manifiestan tener ganas de poder incrementar su producción agrícola y para tal efecto se ven en la necesidad de solicitar capital de inversión para la compra de insumos agrícolas y de tal forma  poder obtener mayores ingresos económicos que vayan a mejorar las condiciones de vida de la familia.
texts.en: Victor Hugo is 23 years old, married, and completed primary school. He lives in his parents’ home. He has one dependent, his little son. His principal economic activity is agricultural production. He cultivates potatoes and broad beans on his own parcels of land that he inherited, and in company (in other words, on the land of someone else, that person has the land and the clients the labour and some agricultural inputs, and at harvest the product is divided in equal parts). His land is located in the community of Sankayani Bajo in the municipality of Tíraque, approximately 75 kilometers away from Cochabamba. Finally, Victor Hugo and his wife show eagerness to be able to increase their agricultural production and therefore, they need to solicit investment capital to buy the agricultural inputs and in this way be able to increase their income, which is going to improve the family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Santa Rosa 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Comité llamado Santa Rosa 2 cuenta con 12 integrantes  en donde todas tienen una pequeña actividad a la cual se dedican por más pequeña que sea. Se unieron con la esperanza de poder ayudar a sus familias y sacarlos adelante.
Patricia es una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, se sacrifica mucho por sus familiares, ya que quiere poder darles todo lo que necesitan para tener una buena vida sin privaciones. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano, en lo que le está yendo bien, ya que la prenda se segunda mano es muy solicitada porque es más barata.
Patricia solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de segunda mano, para poder venderlas y de esa forma seguir teniendo los medios necesarios para poder mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
The Santa Rosa 2 group consists of 12 members, each who has a small business activity through which they earn a living, no matter how small it may be. They have united together with the hope of being able to help their families get ahead. 

Patricia is a very hardworking and determined person. She sacrifices a lot for her family members so that she can give them everything they need to have a good life free from want. She earns her living reselling second-hand clothing. This is going well for her, since second-hand clothing is in high demand because it is cheaper. Patricia is asking for the loan so that she can buy second-hand clothing to resell so that in this way she can continue to support her family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Eliana Olivia

texts.es: La Sra.  Eliana se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la misma zona donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Eliana  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio y  de esta manera brindar mayor comodidad a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Eliana va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando insumos y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener un restaurante y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela. La Sra. Eliana  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Eliana earns her living selling clothing from her stall which is located in the zone where she lives. This is her first loan with this institution. Eliana will use the loan to buy tables and chairs for her business so that she can offer her clients a more comfortable experience. Her reason for asking for the loan is to continue to improve her business. Eliana will use the profits to continue to buy supplies and in this way increase her income. Her dream is to have a restaurant and in this way offer her clients a better service. Eliana is a very hard-working person and is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is being offered.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business.

loans.name: Primavera - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PRIMAVERA - 26 Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Carla  tiene 32 años, y un hijo que tiene la edad de 7 años,  La Sra. Carla se dedica  a la   venta de cosméticos por catalogo, ella vende sus productos de manera ambulante, visitando domicilios y oficinas públicas y privadas de la ciudad de La Paz,  donde ofrece sus productos,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Carla va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de cosmético y joyas por mayor y que se encuentran en promoción y de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a su clientela e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Carla va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando variedad de productos de belleza, la Sra. Carla es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The venture bank PRIMAVERA – 26 is made up of eight members, five women and three men. The president of the bank, Carla, is 32 years old and has a seven-year-old child. Her business is selling cosmetics from a catalog. She sells her products on foot, visiting homes and public and private offices in the city of La Paz, where she offers her products. This is her first loan series with the institution. Carla is going to use this loan to buy cosmetics and jewelry wholesale and on sale, and in this way provide a variety of products to her customers and increase her profits. Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business. Carla is going to utilize the profits to continue buying a variety of beauty products. Carla is a hard-working person who feels happy because of the opportunity provided to her, since her fellow group members, some of them are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of wholesale cosmetics and jewelry.

loans.name: Rolanda

texts.en:
Rolanda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Rolanda sells perfumes in their community. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase perfumes to resell.

Rolanda became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of perfumes to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has a motorcycle business in Nakuru town, has been in the business for the past two years, and it has been profitable. He is 45 years old, married to Susan, and they have four children.

This will be his first loan and he plans to use the amount to buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle. He also plans to use part of the loan amount to renew his motorcycle insurance. With the anticipated income he plans to buy a taxi.

In the future Peter hopes to venture more into the transport business, make more income and be able to provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Saraphina

texts.en: Saraphina is a 58-year-old single woman. She has a son. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, kale, onions and cabbage. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of vegetables for resale. She will use the Kes 21,000 loan to buy a water tank. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased her daily income from her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a water tank worth Kes 21,000

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en: Analyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single with 1 child. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Analyn became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Yusufjon

texts.en: When Yusufjon began his own business 12 years ago, his living condition was very difficult as his income was little and it was not enough for living. Now, he is one of the best businessmen. He is busy with gardening. He has a garden where there are a lot of apricot trees. He dries apricots and makes ‘kuraga’ and then sells it to local people. His business has been developing year by year but his family is big and he needs more money. He wants to buy cattle and in this way get additional income. He and his 5 children await your help and mercy.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Carlos Martin

texts.es: Carlos Martin de 39 años de edad, casado, con cinco hijos todos bajo su responsabilidad ya todos estudian, este emprendedor tiene por actividad economica molino y siembre de caña de azucar en su localidad, tiempo de tener el negocio 16 años, el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion este emprendedor se ha caracterizado por ser un hombre, trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superacion personal, ya que dicha forma se ha propuesto cumplir su objectivo y metas en un futuro, el objectivo del prestamos es adquirir un motor eletrico para el molino de mayor potencia para brindar un mejor servicio y poder consumir menos energia y bajar sus costos de energia eletrica
texts.en: Carlos Martin is 39 years old and married with five children who he is responsible for since they all study. This businessman's economic activity is milling and sowing sugarcane in his town. The business, which he has had for 16 years, is located in his home. This entrepreneur is characterized as a man who is hard-working, responsible, with the personal will to overcome, since that is the way he has proposed to fulfill his objectives and goals in the future. The goal of the loans is to acquire a more powerful electric motor for the mill to provide better service and be able to consume less energy and lower his electricity costs.

loans.use: to buy a more powerful electric motor for the mill to provide better service.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan lives with his parents in Spandarian village, Armenia. The family is involved in agriculture. They raise cows, sheep and chickens and also cultivate potato and barley. Vardan needs to finance the transportation of their potato and barley harvest and their milk products. With the help of a loan he will purchase 300 liters of petrol and 500 liters of diesel fuel. This is important for Vardan to organize sales of his family's produce and hence gather enough income to sustain his family.

loans.use: to pay for fuel for transportation of farm produce

loans.name: Salameh

texts.en:
Salameh is a 59-year-old married man with no children. He opened a small shop in Nabatieh, Lebanon, in 2005, where he sells perfumes, accessories and toys. He enjoys running this kind of business, and works on improving it as much as he can. 

Salameh is a loyal Al Majmoua borrower and this is his seventh loan cycle. He invested the money from his previous loans in his business through adding new products. Today, Salameh is requesting a new loan due to the improvements it will bring to both his social and financial situations. He will again increase his business capital with newly-released products.

He is so excited about this loan because he will use it to respond to his customers' needs. He is always planning to expand his business as much as he can and he hopes to start trading wholesale in the future.

loans.use: to purchase newly-released products for his shop

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.
 
Rosalinda has a rice farm. She has had this business for eight years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 to buy fertilizer for the rice farm.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past three years, Getrude has been working hard to manage her shop, which sells video tapes, CDs and DVDs. 

To help expand her business, Getrude has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another computer, video tapes, CDs and DVDs.
