texts.en: Dative is 43 years old. She has eight children; four of them go to school, while the other four started to manage their small businesses, because she couldn't afford to send them to school. Her husband works as a farmer. She has requested a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell. Dative will use the profits from her business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans and sorghum to sell

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en:
Mwajuma is a 52-year-old married woman blessed with five children, two of whom are still in school. She runs a cereals store which has been in operation for three years. The business brings in a monthly income of approximately KES 12,000 per month.

This is her second loan of 25,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Yehu after successfully repaying her previous loans. She'll use the loan to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas for resale. She'll use the profits gained to pay school fees for her children.

Her hope is that her business does well so that she can venture into a large-scale cereals selling business.
Mwajuma lives in a cement house with electricity but no piped water.

loans.use: to purchase more maize, beans and dried peas for resale.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick, 42 years old, is a plumber in Kilifi. He is a married father of three children. He has been doing plumbing successfully for the past three years .

This is his second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He plans to purchase pliers, spanners and water pipes. He will use the anticipated profits from his business to educate his children and repay his KADET loan. He hopes to have a big business that is going to provide employment to the society.

loans.use: to purchase pliers, spanners and water pipes

loans.name: Wilson Rafael

texts.es: Wilson de 47 años de edad, vive al sur occidente de la ciudad con su cónyuge y tiene 7 hijos en las edades de 15 a 26 años, con quienes sueña se conviertan en personas de éxito. El posee 15 años de experiencia en la fabricación de muebles de comedor, alcobas y de sala, en su propia ebanistería ubicada en un costado de su casa, la cual inició tomando como base la enseñanza de su tío en este oficio. Los productos de mayor rotación comercial son los multimuebles, juegos de alcoba y comedor, por eso aunque maneja todas las líneas, últimamente se ha enfocado en estas. En su proceso desarrolla todas las tareas productivas y de comercialización: compra de madera, pulida, corte preparación ensamble, acabado y ventas, las cuales realiza a pequeños almacenes ubicados en un corredor comercial del centro de la ciudad y a referidos por sus propio mercado. Su tarea diaria es intensa, él inicia su  trabajo desde la 7:00 am hasta las 7:00 de la noche y cada día se esmera en la perfección de su técnica con el fin de sacar adelante a su familia. Actualmente está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará madera, pintura, lija y triplex, en volúmenes, que permitan aumentar su producción y mejorara el volumen de sus ventas, lo cual es lo que hace que la inversión de credikiva sea muy exitosa.
texts.en: Wilson is 47 years old and lives in the south west of the city with his wife.  He has 7 children ranging in age from 15 to 26 years, and he dreams that they will become successful people. He has 15 years of experience in manufacturing furniture for dining rooms, bedrooms, and living rooms.  He has his own cabinetmaker's shop, located on the side of his house, which he started based on his uncle's teaching of the trade. The products in greatest demand are  entertainment centers, as well as bedroom and dining sets.  For that reason, although he can build all the lines, recently he has focused on these products.  In his business he handles all of the labor, purchasing and marketing: He purchases the wood, the polish, does the cut preparation and assembly, as well as the finishing and sales.  He completes his sales at small stores located in a commercial corridor in the center of town as well as through people referred to him via the market.  His daily work is intense.  He begins his work at 7:00 am and continues to 7:00 pm each day and strives to perfect his technique in order to help his family get ahead.  Currently he is applying for a loan from Kiva, the first financing that he is requesting from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  With the loan he will buy wood, paint, sand and plywood in volumes that can increase production and improve his sales volume, which is what makes the Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy wood, paint, sand and plywood in volumes that can increase production

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 37 years old. She sells bananas and sorghum and has been in this business for 12 years.  She plans to use this loan to buy more bananas.

If she is able to realize extra profit because of this loan, she will use it to provide food for her family. Julienne dreams to achieve more in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Shamura

texts.en:
Shamura is 24 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. For the past two years, she has been working hard to manage her small business selling clothes. 

To expand her business, Shamura has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva field partner BRAC Uganda. She plans to use the loan to buy more clothes such as jeans and shirts.  Shamura hopes this will help to generate greater profits.

Shamura is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs such as Shamura who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old. She is the mother of three children, all of whom go to school.  Jacquline has been selling bananas for the past five years.

Jacqueline plas to use this loan to increase the volume of her business.  If she is able to realize greater profits as a result, she will use it  to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Adam

texts.es: El Sr. Adam tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, es chofer de transporte público  hace más de 6 años, actualmente el cliente vive en una casa alquilada, ya que solo tiene terrenos de su propiedad en el área rural, los cuales a futuro piensa trabajarlo con el fin de producir y de esa forma superarse ya que su aspiración es tener un terrenito dentro de la ciudad. El cliente nos comenta además que dice haber cursado hasta la primaria, ya que no pudo concluir el bachillerato por problemas económicos por los que atravesaban sus padres viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo desde muy pequeño y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios, es así que ahora solicita el crédito para poder superarse y crecer ya que tiene muchas aspiraciones. Con el crédito que se le otorgue el piensa  refaccionar su vehículo Microbús, que con mucho sacrificio pudo comprarlo, con el cual espera percibir mayores ingresos  y de esa forma mejorar  su nivel de vida, puesto que con el crédito será más fácil avanzar en el sueño que quiere lograr,  además de sentirse más satisfecho de haber logrado lo que quiso.
texts.en: Adam is single, 30 years old, and has been a public transportation driver for 6 years. He is currently a tenant, since the only lands he owns are in the rural area. In the future, he would like to use them for agricultural production and thus move up in life, since his aspiration is to own a small piece of land inside the city. He says that he was able to complete only primary school, since he was not able to get a secondary school diploma because of his parents' financial troubles. Adam had to look for work at a young age and thus had no choice but to put aside his studies. That is why now he asks for a loan in order to move up in life and grow, since he has many aspirations. With the loan, he wants to repair his vehicle, a Microbus, which was purchased at the cost of a great sacrifice and with which he hopes to increase his income and thus improve his standard of living. Thanks to the loan he will be further along on the path toward his dream, and will also feel satisfied to have reached this intermediary goal of repairing his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair a public transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Ramela

texts.en: Ramela is involved in agriculture. She raises cows, pigs and keeps livestock. Ramela's two sons help their mother with agriculture. Ramela makes cheese from the milk she gets, which she sells in the regional center, Kapan town.  Now Ramela would like to increase the number of cattle by purchaseing two neats and a cow. This will allow Ramela to make more cheese from the milk and increase her sales. Ramela hopes to earn more income and then she will renovate her house and insure a better future for her sons.

loans.use: to pay for 2 neats and a cow

loans.name: Jessica Diana

texts.es:
Jessica es una joven muy trabajadora, tiene 19 años y con el fruto de su trabajo colabora con los gastos del hogar, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. En su tiempo libre e Jessica le gusta mucho escuchar música y sobre todo comer uno de sus platillos favoritos, el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos ella solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de derecho.

Con mucho entusiasmo Jessica trabaja como promotora de ventas en una tienda de su ciudad, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a su familia, ella trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 30 clientes en el día; ella cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y siempre atiende a los clientes con mucha amabilidad.

Jessica está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá compra una cocina a gas ya que en su vivienda tenían una cocina a Kerosene y hace algunos días debido a lo inflamable del combustible tuvo un pequeño accidente que gracias a Dios no paso a mayores y por ello con esta mejora podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y sobre todo más seguridad, así ella podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Tener su casa propis y seguir apoyando a su familia”.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very hard-working young woman. She is nineteen years old, and she contributes her earnings to help with household bills. Her home is located in the city of Ica, a city known for its very warm and friendly climate. As a result of the climate, there is lots of agriculture in the area. Specifically, cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among other crops, are cultivated here. We can also find tourist spots, such as the beautiful Laguna de Huacachina, which is located in the middle of impressive dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are popular. In her free time, Jessica likes to listen to music, and above all she enjoys eating one of her favorite delicious dishes, chicken and rice. Due to her limited economic resources, she only attended high school, but she would have liked to study law.

Jessica works with lots of enthusiasm as a sales promoter in a store in her city. Since she helps her family with her earnings, she works around eight hours a day and can help up to thirty customers in a day. She believes that her work is going well for her because she is very responsible and always helps her customers with lots of kindness.

Jessica is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided her she will be able to purchase a gas stove. Currently, her family has a kerosene stove, which, due to the flammable nature of the fuel, had a small accident a couple days ago. Thankfully, it did not get out of hand, and as a result, with this improvement she will be able to provide a better quality of life to her family, and more importantly, more safety. This way, she will be able to continue working so she will be able to realize her biggest dream: “Have her own home and continue to help her family.”

loans.use: to purchase a gas stove.

loans.name: Goreth

texts.en: Goreth is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She has a business of frying and selling crisps, roasted ground nuts, hard corn and sim -sim. She has been in this business for five years. She generates additional income through selling bread. She supplies her produce to supermarkets in and around Kampala.  She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of ground nuts, Irish potatoes sim-sim and cooking oil.  She would like to own a big store so that she can keep her produce and employ two people to assist in frying. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bags for frying crisps, roasted ground nuts, hard corn and sim-sim.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 34 years old and lives in the town of Msambweni in the coastal region of Kenya. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past three years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells charcoal.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 25,000 Kenya Shillings from Yehu. The loan will be used to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale, and will help her to generate greater profits and open up more businesses. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to open a retail shop.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice is a 35 year-old married woman who lives in the village of Mwambalazi, in the coastal region of Kenya. She sells goats at the market, a business which she has operated for six years. She is married to Musyoka but they have not yet been blessed with any child.
Joice is requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 40,000 to purchase eight goats for sale. She hopes to earn some more profits out of it and be able to expand the business and open a retail shop in future.

loans.use: to purchase eight goats for sale.

loans.name: Salomey

texts.en: Salomey is a 33 year-old fish seller.  She is married and has one child who is two years old. She lives with her family in Teshie community. This is her 4th loan cycle. She needs 900 Ghana cedis so she can buy more fish. The fish business is good in Ghana since almost everybody uses it one way or another. She has been selling fish for the past 7 years. She wants to be a major stakeholder in the fishing supplying business. She needs your help to be able to do a good business.

loans.use: To be able to meet customer demands.

loans.name: Guillermo Felix

texts.es:
Guillermo tiene 49 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima muy cálido y acogedor, asimismo en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura, especialmente se cultiva el algodón, la uva, esparrago, entre otros, podemos encontrar también lugares turísticos como lo es la linda “Laguna e Huacachina”, ubicada en medio de Dunas impresionantes y en las cuales se puede practicar deportes de aventura como el sanboard. Guillermo en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho arreglar cosas, ya que lo distrae mucho, también en ocasione le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “seco de Cabrito”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo estudio hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Guillermo trabaja muy duro en su negocio chofer de mototaxi, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo el puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar y poder salir adelante, Guillermo trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 20 clientes diariamente; él cree que el va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo amable con los clientes.

Guillermo está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado terminara de construir su vivienda, de esta manera podrá tener una vivienda segura y sobre todo podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un taller de mecánica”.
texts.en:
Guillermo is 49 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, a city known for its very warm and friendly climate. As a result of the climate, there is lots of agriculture in the area. Specifically, cotton, grapes, and asparagus, among other crops, are cultivated here. We can also find tourist spots, such as the beautiful Laguna de Huacachina, which is located in the middle of impressive dunes where adventure sports such as sandboarding are popular. In his free time, Guillermo likes to fix things, since it distracts him. Additionally, on occasion he likes to eat one of his favorite delicious dishes, goat stew. Due to his limited economic resources, he only studied until the final year of high school, but he would have liked to study in a university.

From day to day, Guillermo works very hard as a rickshaw taxi driver, since his earnings help him to be able to cover his household costs and to get ahead. Guillermo works around eight hours a day and is able to help up to twenty customers daily. He believes that his business is going well because he is very responsible and, above all, kind to his customers.

Guillermo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to the help they have provided him, he will finish building his house. As a result, he will be able to have a safe home, and, more importantly, he will be able to continue working to be able to realize his biggest dream: “Have a workshop.”

loans.use: To improve his house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes in larger quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette, the mother of three children, lives with them and their father, her long-term partner, and a niece. Since they are living in a deteriorating house, she is requesting her eighth loan, this one to improve the situation by purchasing materials to start building her house's walls, which she will change from wood to concrete block.

Lissete is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs who came to the organization almost four years ago for a loan to expand her business, a beauty salon which produces income she uses to help her family, reinvest, and make loan repayments. She lives in a slum area in the north of Santo Domingo.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program in which most of its clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure while implementing their business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement and other materials.

loans.name: Randy David

texts.es: Randi un joven de 24 años de edad, aficionado a los video-juegos, hace 2 años, decidió generar sus propios ingresos mediante el montaje de una sala de video juegos, dirigida a generar entretenimiento a las nuevas generaciones; hoy  ha logrado consolidar una pequeña clientela, donde jóvenes y niños son sus principales clientes. Diariamente desde las 8:30 de la mañana hasta las 9:30 de la noche,  está dedicado a este negocio, que día a día le produce mas satisfacciones, pues genera ingresos  e identifica en el un importante potencial de crecimiento al cual quiere llegar. Randi se mantiene actualidad y por eso en su oferta están los mas modernos y actualizados videos y juegos, por eso su clientela es cada vez mayor. Su desafío actual es lograr un capital de trabajo que le permita innovar y fortalecer aun mas su clientela; esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual  comprara1 in box, un play Station y 2 canales de video juegos. Con su inversión credikiva, logrará actualizar su oferta y brindarle a su clientela, oportunidades de acceso a juegos modernos, que harán de jóvenes y niños su máxima diversión, mientras Randy continua aumentando sus ingresos.
texts.en: Randy, a young man of 24, is a fan of video games. Two years ago, he decided to generate his own income by setting up a hall for video games, directed to generating entertainment for the new generations. Today he has succeeded in solidifying a small customer base, where youths and children are his principal customers. Every day from 8:30 in the morning until 9:30 at night, he works at his business, which every day produces more satisfaction for him, since it generates income and he identifies in it an important potential for growth that he want to reach. Randy keeps up-to-date, and for this reason his offerings are the most modern and up-to-date videos and games, and so his clientele continues to grow. His present challenge is to obtain working capital to permit him to innovate and strengthen his customer base even more. This is exactly the reason why he has turned to a Kiva loan, which will be his first financing through Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, and which he will use to buy an Xbox, a Play Station, and two channels of video games. With the investment of his Kiva loan, he will update his offerings and offer his customers opportunities to access modern games, which are the most fun for youths and children, while Randy continues to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy an Xbox, a Play Station, and two channels of video games.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Charity owns a tea tree farming business. She also plants maize, potatoes and beans on a small scale and raises cattle and poultry. She started the business through her own savings.

Charity learned about Milango through an employee who invited her to the group. She joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Charity's main challenges are seasonal weather and finding customers.

Charity is applying for a loan of 10,832 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Any extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to expand the business. Charity's future plans are to become a large scale farmer and a supplier in the area.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi is a resident of Malindi, in Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has nine children. Zawadi has owned and operated a grocery shop for four years.

Zawadi learned about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Zawadi's main challenges are price fluctuations, inflation, seasonal weather and taxes.

Zawadi is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to purchase iron sheets for building her grocery shop and renovating it. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her child. Zawadi hopes to open a wholesale grocery shop and become a supplier of her products in the future.

loans.use: To purchase iron sheets for building her grocery shop and renovating it.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr:
	Mr  Mamadou est  à quelques kilomètres de l’IMF, marié et père de famille il vit avec ses frères et sa famille. Mr Mamadou  participe aux dépenses quotidiennes  de la maison, il évolue dans le commerce et  a été encadré par son frère depuis son enfance pour  exceller dans ce domaine 
Il achète du mil pour ensuite le revendre sur le marché, ayant une très grande expérience à la vente Mr  Mamadou  veut diversifier ses produits et pour cela il veut  acheter 200 sacs de foin , de  ce fait il sollicite un crédit de 500 000 f remboursable en 12 mois dont un différé,avec le bénéfice qu’il aura il compte épargner une partie et le reste aider la famille, il est à son troisième prêt  à l’IMF
Mr Mamadou veut un jour voir son fond de commerce très  renforcé  pour pouvoir approvisionner un magasin non exploité.
texts.en:
Mamadou lives a few kilometres from the MFI; married and a father, he lives with his brothers as well as his family. Mamadou contributes to the household's daily expenses; he is a businessman and has been trained since childhood by his brother to excel in this activity. He buys meal to resell in the market. Having a solid experience in sales, Mamadou wants to diversify his offering and therefore he wants to buy 200 bags of hay - for this he is requesting a 500,000 Franc loan over twelve months (with one deferred). With the profits generated, he plans to save some and to help his family with the balance.
This is his third loan from the MFI. Mamadou hopes one day to gather enough capital to be able to stock a currently unused shop.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of hay to sell at the market.

loans.name: Dame

texts.fr: 	Mr Dame est domicilié à environ 16 km de la ville principale, il est marié et père de famille.IL exerce le métier de commerce depuis plus de 10 ans, il achète des choux pour les revendre à Dakar.IL consacre tout son temps au travail en commençant sa journée à 8 h pour la finir à 21 h. Mr Dame a eu à contracté 3 prêts au niveau de l’IMF et il a toujours respecté ses engagement vis-à-vis de l institution.IL demande un crédit de  300 000 f remboursable en 12 mois ,le bénéfice qui aura issu de ces ventes lui permettra de prendre en charge les dépenses quotidiennes et d’épargner. Mr  Dame veut renforcer à l’avenir son fond de roulement pour mieux s’investir dans le maraichage.
texts.en:
Dame is based about 16 km from the main town, he is married and a father. He has worked as a trader for over ten years - he buys cabbages in order to resell them in Dakar. He gives up all his time for work - starting his day at 8am and finishing at 9pm. Dame has had three previous loans with the institution, and he has always respected his commitments to them.
He is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs repayable over 12 months.
The profits that will be generated from these sales will allow him to cover his daily living expenses and to have some savings. In the future, Dame wants to grow his working capital in order to invest further into market gardening.

loans.use: to buy cabbages for resale in Dakar

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He has three children, all of whom attend school. Albert has owned and operated a food cafe for two years. He also earns a salary from a butchery he owns.

Albert learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Albert's main challenges are theft from employees, price fluctuations and inflation.

Albert is applying for a loan of 104,800 Kenya shillings to buy tables and chairs for the cafe. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to educate his children, to buy basic needs and to improve his family's living standards. Albert's dream is to open more food cafes in other areas.

loans.use: To buy tables and chairs for the cafe.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost three years ago for a loan to expand her business. She joined the Hope in You group, located in one of the rural villages in Santo Domingo, where she has received loans to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products.

Juana is a young mother with four children, and she is raising them with her long-term partner in her livelihood in her small slum community outside the north part of Santo Domingo. She is accessing this loan to give her four children a new home. They live in deteriorated housing, and she is requesting a loan to improve her house by purchasing building materials to change the floor and concrete blocks to improve some weakened wooden walls.

Esperanza Internacional runs a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill their commitment to expand their businesses, and show fidelity in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structures while running their business loans and attending group meetings.

loans.use: To buy cement and other construction materials

loans.name: Damaris

texts.fr: Damaris est une dame âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 02 enfants de 09 et de 16 ans. En plus de ses deux enfants qui vont tous à l'école, elle a également à sa charge deux autres personnes, son neveux et sa nièce. comme activité, elle achète des tissus (draps blancs) qu'elle teinte en plusieurs couleurs selon les commandes et les sollicitations des clients qu'elle revend par la suite. elle mène cette activité depuis 03 ans déjà. elle voudrait ce crédit pour acheter des tissus et des produits qu'elle emploie dans la teinture pour augmenter sa capacité de production et par conséquent ses revenus afin de mieux assurer la scolarité de ses enfants et améliorer ses conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Damaris is a 43 year old woman, married and the mother of two children aged 9 and 16. As well as her own two children, who both attend school, she also cares for two additional people - her nephew and her niece. As a business, she buys fabric (white sheets) which she dyes in various colours according to the orders and wishes of her customers; she then sells the dyed fabrics.
She has been doing this for three years already. She is requesting this loan to buy fabric, and the materials she uses in the dye, so that she can increase production - and therefore income - in order to be better able to cover the costs of schooling her children, and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and dyes.

loans.name: Kitsao

texts.en:
Kitsao lives in the Malindi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Kitsao has owned and operated a tailoring business for two years.

Kitsao learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Kitsao's main challenge is clients not paying on time.

Kitsao is applying for a loan of 21,100 Kenya shillings to buy threads, sewing needles and materials for sewing. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to pay his children's school fees and to improve his family's living standards. Kitsao's dreams are to expand to own a school uniform shop and to become a supplier of uniforms.

loans.use: To buy threads, needles and materials for sewing.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a Ghanaian artist specializing in wood carvings, especially masks. She would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood and paint to expand production.

Juliana has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is her story:

Juliana became interested in wood carving while working as a secretary. "I was so fascinated that I decided to learn the trade, and did so through a carver in Aburi. My products are unique; they have a meaning and a history behind them. My favorite carving is the Akuabaa doll, because of its meaning and power. In the Akan tribe of Ghana, the doll represents fertility. When given this doll, it is believed that a woman will be likely to get pregnant."

"I would like to say that your contribution to this interest-free microcredit goes a long way to improve our lives. For this, I thank you so much."

Use the link below to view Juliana's wood carvings on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=4136

loans.use: to purchase wood and paint in bulk for her wood carvings

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a master carver from Ghana who specializes in masks and sculptures. He would like to purchase larger amounts of wood and aluminum plate to increase production of his masks. Evans has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"As of now, carving has made me the breadwinner of my family - they all look to and count on me for their day-to-day survival. My products have been taken to craft markets in France and Germany by a good friend, and these markets have shown wonderful and incredible interest in them. This has given me the ability to attend various arts and craft fairs both locally and internationally. I have showcased several of my products at these fairs, gaining admiration from both my customers and art critics. I would like to say a big thank-you to everybody who is concerned with supporting artisans like me through this interest-free microcredit."

Use the link below to view Evans' hand-carved masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3362

loans.use: to purchase larger amounts of wood and aluminum plate to increase production of his masks

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ghanaian artisan Ernestina specializes in wood carvings. To strengthen production, she would like to invest in the purchase of larger quantities of wood. Ernestina has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is her story:

"I was born in the eastern region of Ghana and trained in dressmaking, but realized that the trade would not do well in my town. I therefore trained for three years as a wood carver, and began developing carvings on my own. Though carving has long been regarded as the preserve of men, I am glad that I have been able to not only infiltrate but also make an impact on the trade."

"Bless all those who assist me to enjoy a fruitful life through this interest-free microcredit. Through your support, I will be able to continue to produce more works, enabling me to pay for my children's education. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Ernestina's wood carvings and drums on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=1447

loans.use: to purchase large quantities of wood for her carvings

loans.name: Juan Edwin

texts.es:
Juan tiene 30 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, paprika, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta salir a caminar un poco ya que la ayuda a despejarse, asimismo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Arroz con pollo”. El logro estudiar la carrera de Ingeniería Industrial, pero debido a que no encontró trabajo tomo la decisión de tener su negocio propio.

Con mucho entusiasmo Juan traba en su negocio de venta de verduras, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día y puede atender hasta 35 clientes diariamente, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque vende productos frescos y de calidad y a un buen precio.

Juan está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar tripley  para poder realizar unas mejoras en su local ya que colocara puertas y hacer divisiones en su local, lo cual le permitirá tener sus productos de manera más ordenada y limpia y dar mas seguridad a su local, así sus clientes podrán comprar sus productos con más seguridad y seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Juan is 30 years old. He lives in the city of Ica, a city that is characterized by its warm and welcoming atmosphere. A lot of agriculture goes on here, particularly the cultivation of cotton, paprika, grapes, asparagus, and other crops. When he has some free time, he likes to go out and walk a little as this clears his head. He also likes to eat one of his favorite dishes, the delicious "rice with chicken". He studied for a degree in industrial engineering but, as he could not find work, he decided to start his own business.
Juan brings a lot of enthusiasm to his work selling vegetables. He works about 8 hours a day and serves up to 35 customers a day. He believes his business is going well because he is very friendly with his customers and, above all, because he sells produce that is fresh, of high quality, and at a good price.
Juan is very grateful for the loans from Kiva as, thanks to the help that they have offered him, he will be able to buy plywood to make some improvements to his stall such as putting in doors and making some divisions. This will enable him to display his produce in a more ordered, cleaner, and more secure way. In this way, his customers will be able to buy his produce with more security. He keeps working every day to make his greatest dream come true: to have his own house.

loans.use: to buy plywood.

loans.name: Keleh

texts.en:
Keleh is 32 years old and lives in the town of Rubindi in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Keleh has been working hard to manage his tailor shop, where he sells and tailors school uniforms. 

To help expand his business, Keleh has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tailoring machines and school uniforms, and will help Keleh to generate greater profits and expand his business due to increased capacity with new tailoring machines. Keleh hopes that in the future he will be able to set up a tailoring school. 

Keleh is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Keleh who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring machines and school uniforms.

loans.name: Odile

texts.en:
Odile is 22 years old. She sells bananas and has been in that business for the past five years. With the loan, she wants to increase the volume of her stock. 

The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas for resale.

loans.name: Zosimo

texts.en:
Zosimo weaves tapestries and rugs on a traditional Andean handloom. He would like to stock up on the wool and cotton yarns that he uses in his weavings.

Zosimo has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

Zosimo comes from a family of weavers in Ayacucho, renowned for its handicrafts. Like his grandparents and brothers, he works on a traditional handloom. Forced to abandon Ayacucho due to turmoil and violence, Zosimo and his family moved to an urban center where they faced innumerable obstacles. Nonetheless, his dedication has allowed him to succeed. His goal is to teach his children the textile art once they are old enough.

"I want to thank you for your much needed help. Sometimes, for a variety of reasons, I am unable to have a supply of all my designs available. But with your assistance, I will be able to keep a permanent stock of my designs and be able to have good sales at the end of this year."

Use the link below to view Zosimo's hand-loomed tapestries and rugs on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3153

loans.use: to purchase wool and cotton yarn for his tapestries and rugs

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is an artisan who creates extraordinarily detailed works of art in batik. He would like to purchase dye and other raw materials that he needs to create his artwork.

Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"In college I majored in the arts, specializing in textiles and sculpture. After my university education, I joined the Arts Council of Ghana from 1986 to date. I have developed my own techniques in batik production, using reactive dyes to achieve the same or better effects than would be derived in traditional paintings. The results have been marvelous! My themes are mainly of women, beach scenes and landscapes. I try to depict the daily activities of women in Africa to support the fight for equality for the African woman."

"I'd like to express my gratitude to you who are assisting me with this microcredit. This will encourage me to produce more. Thank you so much!"

Use the link below to view Samuel's batik artwork on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3551

loans.use: to purchase dye and other raw materials that he needs to create his artwork

loans.name: Benito

texts.en:
Benito is an artisan who specializes in the crafting of traditional Andean musical instruments. He would like to invest in the purchase of raw materials, such as wood, strings and accessories, for the production of his flutes and charango guitars. Benito has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

Benito is an expert at crafting traditional Peruvian musical instruments, such as zampoña and quena flutes, tambourines, charangos and ocarinas. Each one is handcrafted using rustic tools. "Aiding in the preservation of our musical heritage is my family's legacy. We have carefully crafted traditional instruments for generations," he says.

"I am an artisan interested in making it on my own, but sometimes people need some form of assistance. This is why I would like you to know how grateful I am for your support through this interest-free microcredit. With it, I hope to really increase my sales this year. Thank you very much."

Use the link below to view Benito's musical instruments on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/artistdetail/index.cfm?faid=3596

loans.use: to purchase wood, strings and accessories for his musical instruments

loans.name: Amada

texts.en: Amada is requesting a $600 loan to buy additional supplies for her  restaurant, including meat and vegetables. She started her restaurant in 2003, and has been earning a good income from it. Amada is happy with the loan that she is taking. She wants to open a big restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her restaurant, including meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina, 43 years old, is married to a man who works at the airport. Both of them support their 8 children, 4 of them already in school. Celestina operates a restaurant in her city. She started this restaurant in 2007 with a working capital of $500. This loan helps Celestina to purchase some additional supplies for her restaurant, including animals.

Celestina lives in a house made of bricks and a roof of zinc. She hopes that her business can be successful and that she can build a good house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some additional supplies for her restaurant, including animals.

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Vumilia est leader du  groupe d’affaire La joie, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Son mari est un chômeur. Elle est vendeuse de denrées alimentaires au marché Nyabushongo. Elle commença son entreprise avec  crédit de l’IMF Hekima. Elle vient de réaliser 13 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit de Hekima.  Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 2 sacs de haricots. Dit-elle, sa famille dépend de cette activité. Grace aux crédits qu’elle bénéficie, elle supporte aisément les frais scolaires, l’alimentation, etc.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Vumilia is the leader of the "La Joie" business group; she is married and the mother of six children. Her husband is unemployed. She is a seller of foodstuffs at the market in Nyabushongo. She started her business with a loan from Hekima. She has recently completed her 13th cycle in the microcredit program at Hekima.
This new loan will allow her to purchase two sacks of beans. She states that her family are dependent on this business. Thanks to the loans from which she has benefited, she is easily able to cover the costs of schooling, food, etc.
Therefore, she thanks Hekima for its help, and for supporting the autonomy of women small entrepreneurs.
It should be noted that some women are holding their babies.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of beans.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Annie Nadège

texts.fr: Annie Nadège est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 24 ans, célibataire et mère d'un enfant de 11 mois. depuis 04 ans, elle gère un salon de coiffure dans un quartier de la ville. elle y vend également des produits de beauté. Avec ce crédit, elle voudrait acheter des mèches (en plusieurs variétés) et des produits cosmétiques (lait de toilette, gèl, vernis, etc...) non seulement pour renforcer son stock de marchandises, mais aussi pour la diversifier afin de pouvoir répondre à la demande de sa clientèle qui s'approvisionne souvent ailleurs lorsqu'elle n'a pas les produits sollicités. les revenus générés par son activité lui permettront d’améliorer ses conditions de vie et d'assurer l'éducation de son enfant.
texts.en:
Annie Nadège is a young woman from Cameroun - 24 years old. She is single and the mother of one 11 month old child. For four years, she has run a hairdressing salon in a neighbourhood of town. She also sells beauty products there. With this loan, she would like to buy hair extensions (of various types), and cosmetic products (lotion, hair gel, nail varnish etc) not only to improve her stock of merchandise, but also to diversify it so that she can meet the demand of her customers who often buy things elsewhere when she does not have what they want.
The income generated from this activity will allow her to improve her standard of living, and to ensure her child's education.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Con 26,250 pesos Miguelina podrá comprar mercancía pra aumentar el inventario de su tienda de venta de ropa y electrodometicos de segunda mano. Hace ya unos tres años que Miguelina inició en este negocio, el cual le permite ayudar a mantener su casa. Miguelina es viuda desde hace cuatro meses. Este ha sido un tiempo muy dificil para ella. "He logrado mantenerme de pie por el apoyo de mis hijos y al amor de mis nietos" 
Miguelina tiene cuatro hijos, el mayor tiene 37 y la menor 28. Todos ya se han casado y tienen hijos.
Miguelina desea que su tienda siga creciendo, que sea un negocio dinámico que le ayude a poder mantenerse, ya que ahora no cuenta con el inconcional apoyo que siempre tuvo en su esposo.
texts.en:
With this loan of 26,250 DOP, Miguelina will be able to buy merchandise to increase the inventory of her shop where she sells secondhand clothing and household appliances. She started this business about three years ago and it has enabled her to sustain her household. Miguelina became a widow just four months ago, so it has been a very difficult time for her. “I have been able to stay on my feet with the support of my children and the love of my grandchildren”, she says.

Miguelina has four children. The oldest is 37 and the youngest is 28. All of them are married and have children. Miguelina wants to grow her shop so that it becomes a dynamic business she can use to sustain herself. At the moment, she does not have the unconditional support that her husband always provided.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 27 years old and married to a man who is working in a local NGO. 

She is requesting the loan to buy additional supplies to put in her store including noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, and rice. She started with a working capital of $500 in 2010. She lives in a town just nearby the city. 

She hopes to make her business bigger than this in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her store including noodles, cigarettes, biscuits, and rice.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 49 years old, is married and has 3 children. Angelina works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, she has operated a business buying and selling plastic wares and appliances in the Philippines. She also earns an income from food vending.

Angelina has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her business. Angelina has previously borrowed and repaid 16 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ascion

texts.en:
Ascion, 36 years old, is married and has 2 children. Ascion works hard to provide for her family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Ascion has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ascion has previously borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marimel

texts.en: Marimel, 43 years old, is married and lives in the Philippines. For the past 5 years, she has operated an Internet cafe that offers encoding, printing and online games. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance and to pay for electricity. Marimel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for maintenance

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children. For the past 9 years, Joy has operated a business selling dried fish and eggs in her community. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more dried fish and eggs to resell. Joy has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and eggs to resell

loans.name: Kavira

texts.fr: La cliente Kavira est un entrepreneur expérimenté, veuve, mère de 6 enfants, parmi les quels, il ya des étudiants et d’autres qui ont déjà leurs foyers. La cliente est vendeuse de farine de maniocs dans un dépôt agricole de stockage, situé dans le centre commercial de Birere. Elle a commence cette activité depuis sa jeunesse, de lors, qu’elle fut mariée. Son mari fut décédé suite a une courte maladie causa l’arrêt cardiaque. Le défi majeur de cette activité dit-elle, est qu’elle vend parfois en crédit avec risque de ne pas être payé.Ce nouveau crédit lui servir de s'approvisionner avec 30 sacs de farine de maniocs. Grace aux crédits de Hekima, elle parvient à scolariser ses enfants et marier pour d’autres. Ainsi, elle souhaite voir son capital augmente en volume.  Elle remercie Hekima pour son appui  et autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs femmes.
texts.en:
Kavira is an experienced entrepreneur, a widow and the mother of six children - some of whom are students, others have already left home and are living in their own families. She is a seller of cassava flour from an agricultural store situated in the Birere shopping centre. She began this business when she was young; she was married at the time. Her husband died following a short illness which provoked a heart attack.
The main difficulty with this business, she says, is that she often sells on credit - with the risk of not being paid.
This new loan will allow her to stock up with thirty sacks of cassava flour. Due to the loans from Hekima, she is able to fund her children's education and/or marriage as the case may be. With these loans, she wants to grow the size of her working capital.
She thanks Hekima for its support for the independence of women small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase thirty sacks of cassava flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Carmen Celia

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 36 años, se destaca por ser una mujer tranquila, responsable y muy trabajadora. Carmen vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en Atuntaqui que se encuentra cerca de Otavalo.

Carmen trabaja con su familia en la crianza de animales como cerdos, pollos y cuyes, pero le pone mayor empeño en la crianza de cuyes debido a que es una zona de mayor consumo de cuyes y le va bien en el negocio y con estos ingresos puede ayudar a sus hijos con sus estudios. Carmen realiza un crédito en Fodemi para invertir en  la compra de cuyes reproductores para mejorar la raza y que sean de mejor calidad para su venta y también para la compra de pollos.

Carmen sueña mejor la calidad de vida de su familia y que sus hijos puedan ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Carmen, 36, stands out as a peaceful, responsible and hard-working woman.   She lives with her husband and their two children in Atuntaqui, near Otavalo.

Carmen raises animals such as pigs, chickens and guinea pigs but she gives more attention to raising guinea pigs since the people in the area where she lives eat many and her business is going well.  She will use the income to help her children in their schooling.  Carmen will use the loan from Fodemi to buy breeding guinea pigs to improve her stock so that they will be better quality for sale, and she will also buy chickens.

Carmen dreams of improving the quality of life for her family and wants her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy breeding guinea pigs to improve her sto k so that they will be better quality for sale, and she will also buy chickens.

loans.name: Mwila

texts.en:
Mwila has just completed her training with Mobile Transactions Zambia to start running her own mobile money transfer business as a champion agent. This is her story….

My name is Mwila. I am the mother of a 1 year, 10 months old son. I grew up in a town called Chipata, and I am the fifth born in a family of six. I came to Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia, to undergo training so that I can start running my own shop. I have successfully completed this training and now need a loan to start running my shop.

I intend to open my shop in my hometown of Chipata, because I feel the community there will benefit in having easy access to send and receive money to and from their friends and relatives. Also, the way I look at it, Chipata is a city in waiting and people there have caught up with technology and need as many mobile money transfer shops as possible.

With this Kiva loan I will be able to start running my own shop. I will pay rental for the trading booth, which I will be using for transactions. I will also use the money to brand my booth, hire at least one person, and get some chairs and phones.

I am very excited to get a Kiva loan and start running my own business because the profits that I will start earning will enable me to provide a good life and education for my son.

In the video, a representative from Mobile Transactions interviews Mwila.

loans.use: to open up a mobile money transfer shop

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is one of Esperanza Internacional's entrepreneurs. She came to Esperanza Internacional almost 4 years ago for a loan to expand her business. She is receiving her 8th loan and will use it for her home improvement. She is running a Fantasia (a small store) where she sells miscellaneous products. She lives in a slum area in the north of Santo Domingo.

Rosita is the widowed mother of two children, only one of whom lives with her.  Because they are living in deteriorated housing, she is requesting a loan, which she will use to improve her situation by purchasing building materials to finish building her house.  She started several years ago, but she wasn't able to finish because of the money.  She has been saving her business profits to complete the cost with this loan.

Esperanza Internacional is running a program where most of their clients pay back their loans, fulfill the commitment to expand their businesses, and show reliability in their groups. They can request loans to improve their house structure, while running their businesses and attending group meetings.

loans.use: To buy cement and other construction materials

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en:
Karya Murni Abadi group received the fifth loan, with the loan amount of 9,000,000 IDR. Nothing has changed in the membership and composition of the board. Only one member named Kadek cannot attend the meeting because she is sick and is represented by her husband. The loan in this period is used to buy piglets and sows.

I Putu, head of the group, is using the loan to buy two piglets and the rest to fix the cage. He has plans to keep a sow and become a piglets seller. Currently the price is quite expensive for piglets, 450,000 IDR per piglet. 

I Putu has a dream that this business will become a major source of family income.

loans.use: to buy two piglets and use the rest to fix the cage.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 7 years, Maribeth has operated a business selling RTW's such as t-shirts, pants, blouses and shoes in her local community. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase RTW's to resell. Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase ready-to-wear products to resell

loans.name: Percelina

texts.en:
Percelina is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 10 children. 

Percelina has a tailoring shop where she makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy textiles used in making school and office uniforms.

Percelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Percelina hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy textiles to make school and office uniforms

loans.name: Riechie

texts.en: Riechie  is  36  years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Riechie has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 13 years. She requested a loan for  5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Riechie  has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Riechie hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Rejuntadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo está constituido por 19 integrantes muy activas las mismas trabajan siempre con mucho dinamismo y unidad, y así se ayudan las unas a las otras en todos sus proyectos.
La Sra. Delicia es una de las miembros, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta de queso y leche. Todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana que es cuando reparte casa por cosas todos los productos que tiene y así, por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de queso y leche, ya que quiere poder seguir cumpliendo con la demanda de sus clientes y atraer a más de ellos.
texts.en:
This group consists of 19 active members who are always working with great energy and unity. They help one another in all of their projects.

Sra. Delicia is one of these members. She says that she sells cheese and milk. Every day she begins her work in the early hours of the morning. Delicia leaves her house in order to deliver all of the products she has in stock. Through her work, she is able to help her family.

Delicia is requesting a loan in order to buy cheese and milk because she wants to continue meeting the demands of her customers and bring them more to sell.

loans.use: to buy milk and cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock (sweaters, jackets, sweatshirts, jeans, and other things)

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en:
These 8 ladies sell various goods and hair products. They need this loan to buy items like maize, beans, plantain, cassava, panties and brassieres, Coca-Cola, assorted drinks, fish, charcoal, provisions, shampoo and hair conditioners. They are between their first and third loan cycles with ID-Ghana and they have paid previous loans promptly. They are living in a small area called Otinkorang in Teshie township. They have formed this group to empower women in this area through trading. All of them sell the commodities listed above with the exception of Grace who is a hairdresser. All are married with children.  

Mary is a beans and maize seller and has been in this business for 4 years at her residence. She distributes to customers over a period  of days and collects her money immediately. She buy her items at wholesale price and supplies them at retail. She has ready customers who pay back right away. Her monthly profit is 150 GHS which she uses partially to support her home, reinvesting the rest.

They need a total amount of 3,800 GHS to be able to meet customer needs.

loans.use: To buy items such as maize, beans, plantain, cassava, panties and brassieres, Coca-Cola, assorted drinks, fish, charcoal, provisions, shampoo and hair conditioners to sell to customers

loans.name: Rechel

texts.en:
Rechel is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Rechel is selling frozen products like bacon, longganisa (pork sausage), and hot dogs. Aside from that, she also sells dried fish. She has had this business for five years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to purchase frozen products and dried fish to resell.

Rechel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase frozen products and dried fish to resell.

loans.name: Mawar Group

texts.en:
To expand their businesses, the Mawar group has continued to borrow a loan from MUK. They feel comfortable to have the loan, because they also have been trained by MUK staff. 

After succeeding at the last loan, Ni Komang continues to borrow a loan to purchase two superior piglets to sell for fattened pigs. Now the price for one superior piglet is 500,000 IDR. All the profit from this business will be savings. She hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: To purchase two superior piglets

loans.name: Tati

texts.en:
Tati is 49 years old and lives in Gilimanuk, West Bali.  She is married and has three children, and they are all still in school.   Her husband is a goverment officer.   She has a textile business (embroidery business).   She has been in this business for five years. 
 
With this effort she was able to provide jobs for women in her neighborhood. She makes bags, clothes and other types of ladies' accessories sold to Denpasar. She needs this loan to buy yarn and needles. She receives an order in large enough quantities. She hopes these efforts will be more advanced, could provide jobs for many women and certainly provide welfare for her family.

loans.use: To buy yarn and needles

loans.name: Suhrob

texts.en:
Suhrob is a very clever boy. He graduated school with excellence and good marks. He was one of the best pupils of his school. He likes math, computers, geography and other subjects. His hobby is playing football. His classmates like him very much. He is going to enter the Economic University. His parents are workers and work in a factory. Their income is too small to pay for Suhrob’s study at the university. 

Suhrob wants to be one of the best economists in his town. He is purposeful and hardworking. Please, help him to realize his dream. He is asking for a loan of 1050 USD to pay for study at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for study at the university

loans.name: Lemorai Group

texts.en:
Joaninha, 24 years old, is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. Joaninha started this business 1 year ago with a working capital of $500. She is requesting this loan to purchase some additional items including sugar, cigarettes and biscuits.

Joaninha lives in a house make of bricks and a roof of zinc. She wants to open a big store and build a good house for her family in the future. In the photo, Joaninha is holding the folder.

loans.use: To buy some needed items to sell

loans.name: Huriyatkhon

texts.en:
Huriyatkhon is very successful businesswoman. She has owned her business for more than 6 years. She sells food products in her shop, which is situated near her house. Many of her customers are her neighbors. Huriyatkhon's lovely husband helps her with the business. They also earn additional income from animal husbandry.

Huriyatkhon and her husband want to comfort their 4 children with all the necessities but their income is small and they need your help. Huriyatkhon is asking for a loan to buy goods such as pasta, salt, tomatoes, sugar, etc. for the developing business. Huriyatkhon is one of our organization's best clients and she has a good credit history. She and her husband await your support.

loans.use: To buy goods such as pasta, salt, tomatoes

loans.name: Rollin Ronald

texts.es:
Rollin tiene 40 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive en con sus padres en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Chulucanas, en la región Piura. Su padre es trabajador jubilado y su madre cuenta con una bodega en su domicilio. El se encarga de cuidarlos y velar por su seguridad ahora que ya son mayores.

La actividad que desarrolla para ganarse su sustento y apoyar en el sostenimiento de su familia es el servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi, el ofrece este servicio recorriendo los caseríos aledaños y cuenta con todos sus documentos y licencias en regla, por lo que puede ofrecer este servicio de modo seguro. Esta labor la realiza desde hace más de 10 años. 

Debido a la geografía accidentada de la zona y al excesivo uso, su vehículo necesita de mantenimiento y reparación para poder garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello está solicitando un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles. 

Rollin agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Rollin is 40 years old, he is single and has no children. He lives with his parents in one of the hamlets of the rural district of Chulucanas, in the Piura region. His father is on retirement and his mother runs a small store in their house. He looks after them and cares for their security now that they are in their old age.

To earn his living and support his family he provides cargo and passengers transportation services with a moto-taxi*. He offers his service driving to the neighboring hamlets, and he has all the necessary documents and licenses enabling him to sagely offer this service. He has been engaged in this activity for more than 10 years.

Owing to the uneven surfaces of the area and to the excessive use, his vehicle needs to be maintained and repaired in order to grant its correct functioning, and for this reason he is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN.

Rollin gives thanks in advance for the support received.

<cite>*A “moto taxi” is a motorcycle with a tricycle-like attachment.</cite>

loans.use: To pay for the maintenace of his vehicle.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María es una persona que se considera alegre, amable y muy responsable en su trabajo. María vive con su esposo y sus nueve hijos en la ciudad de Otavalo.

María trabaja con sus hijos mayores en la crianza de ganado para la producción de leche. En este negocio está casi 13 años, mediante ha transcurrido el tiempo maría ha ido teniendo muchos clientes, es por eso que decide realizar un préstamo a fodemi el mismo que lo va a invertir en la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar la producción de leche para poder abastecer a sus clientes y también para la compra de cuyes lo cual incrementará sus ventas e ingresos.

María tiene muchos objetivos que desea cumplir como el de tener más vacas lecheras y ser una distribuidora mayoritaria, también entrar al negocio de crianza y ventas de cerdos para mejorar la calidad de vida de todos sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is considered to be a person who is cheerful, kind, and very responsible in her work.  María lives with her husband and their nine children in the city of Otavalo.

María works with her older children raising cows for milk production.  She has been in this business for almost 13 years.  As time has passed María has had a lot of customers.

That is why she decided to get a loan from Fodemi.  She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production.  She will do this to be able to supply her customers.  She will also buy guinea pigs, which will increase her sales and her income.

María has a lot of objectives she wishes to meet.  One is to have more dairy cows and to become a major distributor.  She would also like to enter into the business of raising and selling pigs.  She wants to do this in order to improve the quality of life for all of her children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and guinea pigs.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis runs a butcher shop and also operates a pub. He had previously acquired a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to buy a bull for slaughter. Francis now needs a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a bull for slaughter, crates of beer and a fridge. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a bull for slaughter, crates of beer and a fridge.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is a 40-year-old fishmonger in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is married and a mother of three, and she has been doing this business successfully for the last three years. 

This marks her fourth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more prawns, Nile perch fish, and sardines to resell to her customers. 

The anticipated profits will be used to buy more stock of fish and repay her loan. She hopes to realize more profits from the sales and thus be able to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more prawns, Nile perch fish, and sardines.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 44 años y es casada con 1 hijo de la edad de veinte años, se dedica  a la  venta de leche y queso ya que tiene ganado vacuno, ella vive en la zona de Litoral, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Martha utilizara  este préstamo para la compra de forraje para su ganado,  Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es no tiene dinero y necesita alimentar bien a su ganado para que le proporcione buena cantidad de leche y así de esta manera producir más quesos y mejorar sus ingresos económicos, Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son el forraje que debe comprar cada cierto tiempo, y  utilizara los beneficios mejorar su ganado,  sueña comprar otras vacas lecheras.
texts.en: Martha is 44 years old, she is married and she has 1 child aged 20. As she owns some cattle she sells milk and cheese. She lives in the Litoral area, and this is her first loan with the institution. Martha will use the loan to buy fodder for her cattle. The reason she is requesting this loan is that she has not enough money and she needs to correctly feed her cattle in order to obtain a good quantity of milk, consequently producing more cheese and improving her earnings. In her activity Matha faces some challenges, such has having to buy fodder at given times, and she will use the benefits to improve her cattle. She dreams of buying other cows.

loans.use: To buy fodder for her cattle.

loans.name: Jorge Rudy

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 37 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa con quien tiene un precioso niño de 5 años, el cual es muy juguetón y travieso, Jorge lo ama muchísimo a pesar de que le saca canas verdes pero es el mejor regalo que dios le ha podido dar. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, tiene playas hermosas y también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son muy alegres y son muy conocidos por su gran don en la preparación de platillos ya que cocinas riquísimo. Jorge en su tiempo libre le gusta mucho pasear con su familia, sobre todo porque es un momento de unión y de compartir, asimismo aprovecha la oportunidad para comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Pachamanca”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Jorge trabaja en un negocio de vulcanizado desde hace ya 4 años, trabaja alrededor de 9 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y siempre realiza un buen trabajo, por ello siempre lo recomiendan. 

Jorge está muy agradecido con los prestatarios kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de una cerca en su vivienda y también poder mejorar las paredes ya que se encuentran resquebrajadas, así de esta manera tendrá una vivienda más segura para poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y con ellos seguirá trabajando para así poder luchar por cumplir  más grande sueño:” Terminar de construir su casa de material noble y poder tener su taller en su vivienda y ya no pagar alquiler”.
texts.en:
Jorge is 37 years old. He lives with his wife, with whom he has a precious 5 year old son who is very playful and naughty. Jorge loves him very much despite the fact that he drives him crazy, but he is the best gift that god has given him. His home is located in Chincha, a city that is characterized by its warm and welcoming climate. It has beautiful beaches and is also the cradle of the big glories of Peruvian sport. Its people are very cheerful and well known for being gifted in making delicious food. In his spare time, Jorge likes to stroll in the city with his family, above all because it is a moment to come together and share. He also likes to take the opportunity to eat one of his favorite dishes such as the very tasty Pachamanca, a baked meat dish.
Due to the lack of economic resources, he only studied through high school but he would very much like to study for a university degree. 
Day in and day out, Jorge runs a vulcanizing business and has been doing this for 4 years. He works about 9 hours a day and can serve 15 customers in a day. He believes that his business is doing well because he is very friendly and always does good work. As a result, his customers always recommend him.
Jorge is very grateful for the Kiva loans because, thanks to the help that has been offered to him, he will be able to build a fence at his house and also improve the walls as they are cracked. In this way, he will have a safer house to give a better quality of life to his family. He will be able to keep working towards completing his greatest goal: to finish building his house from good materials and to have a workshop in his home so he doesn't have to pay rent.

loans.use: to build a fence.

loans.name: Facundo

texts.es:
Facundo, esta casado y tiene tres hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia ocupando tres habitaciones, la casa esta ubicada en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja como albañil y realiza todo tipo de trabajos en construcción trabajando por más de doce  horas al día ya que es el único que cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia y con lo poco que gana no le alcanza .
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de un  nuevo inodoro y  el arreglo completo de su baño ya que se encuentra muy deteriorado, de esta forma desea mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Facundo es construir más habitaciones para dar más comodidad a su familia y también mejorar sus ingresos.
Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Facundo is married and has three school age children.  They live in their own house, occupying three rooms.  The house is in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

He currently works as a bricklayer, and he does all types of construction work.  He works for over 12 hours a day because he is the only one who covers the family’s expenses for food, education, and basic services.  The little that he earns is not enough.

The loan he is requesting is to buy a new toilet and to completely repair his bathroom because it is very dilapidated.  This way he wishes to improve his quality of life.

Facundo’s dream is to build more rooms in order for his family to be more comfortable and to improve his income.

This is the sixth time he has requested a loan from IMPRO and the first time from Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a toilet and to pay expenses to completely repair the bathroom at his house.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en: Gulbahor is a hard-working woman. She has owned her business for more than 9 years. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She knows all aspects of her business very well and her experiences help her to be the best among other businesswomen. In the local market she has many customers. Many of them are butchers and all of them are glad for her work because she works with pleasure and has the best results. She wants to develop her business and that’s why she needs your help. She is asking for a loan to buy young cattle to develop her business.  She promises to pay the loan on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle to develop her business

loans.name: Unidade Group

texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old. She is a widow woman with her five children all in school. She sells bread in front of her home. 

She will purchase additional supplies, including flour, oil, and sugar, for her to make bread. She started this business one year ago. 

She lives in a house made of bricks and zinc for the roof. She hopes that with the loan she can build a good house and support her children to go to university. 

Ana is a group leader from Unidade Group, which means Unity Group. She is the one holding the document.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, and sugar to make bread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood to resell.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: La Señora Aida tiene 58 años ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de edredones, sabanas y frazadas en su tienda que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio,  este préstamo es su segunda secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Srta. Aida va a usar este préstamo para la compra de variedad de frazadas y edredones por mayor para combatir esta época de invierno para surtir su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que le hicieron algunos pedidos y no contaba con el capital necesario para de sus productos, Aida enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia y la alta demanda por la época y va a utilizar los beneficios en aumentar su mercadería y por ende sus ventas.
texts.en: Aida is 58 years old. She sells different kinds of duvets, sheets and blankets in a shop she has set in her own house. This is the second loan she has requested to the institution. Aida will use this loans to buy different kinds of blankets and duvets at wholesale Price to stock up her shop and face the winter season. The reason she is requesting this loan is that she has received some orders but she did not have the necessary working capital to buy her products.
