In her activity Aida has to face some challenges, such as competition and the great number of request for the coming season; she will use the benefits to increase the number of her products, thus improving her sales.

loans.use: To buy blankets and duvets.

loans.name: Maria Soledad

texts.es:
María Soledad tiene 45  años de edad, es soltera y reside en uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito de Túcume, una zona agrícola, comercial y turística, gracias a un complejo de ruinas arqueológicas que se encuentra en la zona.

Ella obtiene ingresos a través del negocio de crianza y venta de animales menores y de la confección de prendas de vestir por pedido. Se dedica a estas actividades desde que era bastante joven por lo que conoce a la perfección el negocio y es bastante conocida en la zona. Actualmente comercializa ovejas y aves entre los negociantes del lugar y también en los mercados. En cuanto a la confección de prendas de vestir ella la realiza al por mayor y la vende a los comerciantes que le realizan pedidos con anticipación.

Los ingresos de estas actividades le sirven para sostenerse económicamente. Ella es una mujer bastante creativa y trabajadora. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 3000 nuevo soles que planea utilizar en la compra de alimentos para sus animales y materiales como telas e hilos para su negocio de confección.

María Soledad agradece de antemano el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Maria Soledad is 45 years old, she is single and she lives in one of the hamlets of the rural district of Túcume, an agricultural, commercial and tourist area known for the archeological ruins that can be found here.

She earns her living by breeding and selling small animals and by creating clothes by order. She has been engaged in these activities from a very young age, she therefore knows the job to perfection and she is fairly renowned in the area. She currently sells sheep and birds among the retailers of her area as well as in the markets. As far as creating clothes is concerned, she creates them as a supplier and she sells them to retailers who place orders with her in advance.

She needs the earnings of her activities to economically provide for herself. She is a fairly creative and hardworking woman. She is currently requesting a loan of 3000 PEN that she will use to buy food for her animals and items such as cloths and threads for her tailoring activity.

Maria Soledad gives thanks in advance for the support received.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, and cloths and thread for her tayloring activity.

loans.name: Kuña Marangatu Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la ciudad de Encarnación, gracias a su trabajo y dedicación ya está en el ciclo número 23, donde todas ellas trabajan y se ayudan para poder salir adelante.
Margarita es una de las miembros del grupo, se dedica a la venta de comestibles de todo tipo, como ser empanadas, sándwich, croquetas y demás. Comenta que al principio tenía pocos clientes, pero que después gracias a su buena sazón pudo atraer a más clientes y hoy en día ya cuenta con una clientela bien formada.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de condimentos, verduras, hortalizas, carne, etc, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y deleitando a sus clientes con sus comidas.
texts.en:
This group is from the city of Encaración. Thanks to their hard work and dedication they are now on cycle number 23, during which all of them work and help one another to get ahead. 

Margarita is one of the members of the group. She works selling foods of all types, like empanadas, sandwiches, fried rolls and more. She told us that at first she had only a few customers, but later, thanks to her good seasoning, she was able to attract more customers and today she has a well formed clientele. 

She seeks this loan to buy condiments, greens, vegetables, meat, etc. With it she will be able to continue working and delighting her clients with her meals.

loans.use: to buy condiments, greens, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Maria Magdalena tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente y sin hijos. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente. La casa está ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande al norte de Peru. Clienta vive en la parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicio de luz. A pesar de su corta edad Maria a demonstrado ser una persona que quiere ser parte activa de su entorno. Por eso, basado en lo que ha aprendido desde que era niña, ahora esta poniendo en practica lo aprendido. La actividad que desarrolla Maria es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Cuenta con más de 10 años en el negocio. Ella es joven y no tiene mucha experiencia crediticia, pero cuenta con el apoyo de su famialia. Su conviviente es agricultor, actualmente trabaja en una empresa avícola en Trujillo. El suegro de la titular firma como aval en el presente crédito. El aval es cliente de EA con muy buen record de pagos. Asi ella busca sacar un prestamo de 1500 soles con Kiva y Epdyme Alternativa que será para la compra alimento balanceado para su ganado menor.
texts.en: Maria Magdalena is 22 years old, she lives with her life partner in their own house and they have no children. Their house is located in the Tambogrande district, in the north of Peru. She lives in the rural part of the district and she does not have electricity. Notwithstanding her young age, Maria has proven herself to be a person who wants to have an active role in her environment. For this reason, she is now putting into practice what she has learned since she was a child. Maria breeds small animals (sheep, pigs and poultry) that she sells in the local market once they have reached the ideal size and weight, and she has been engaged in this activity for more than 10 years. She is young and she does not have much experience with the loans, but she can count on the support of her family. He partner is a farmer, currently working for a poultry company in Trujillo. Her father-in-law will sign as a guarantor for the present loan, as he is a customer of Epdyme Alternativa and has a good repayment record. She is therefore requesting a loan of 1500 PEN through Kiva and Epdyme Alternativa, and she will use it to buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for her animals.

loans.name: Alicia Maribel

texts.es: ALICIA TIENE 45 AÑOS ES SOLTERA Y CONOCIDA EN SU COMUNIDAD POR SU LABOR DE PAPELERIA Y LIBRERIA.  VIVE CON SU MADRE, A QUIEN CUIDA Y APOYA, MIENTRAS QUE LA MADRE TAMBIEN COLABORA EN LAS LABOR DEL NEGOCIO. ALICIA ES UNA PERSONA CON BUENAS REFERENCIAS CON UNA FAMILIA UNIDA Y VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD DEDICADA AL COMERCIO, AGRICULTURA Y GANADERIA, AL NORTE DEL PERU. ELLA HA DEMONSTRADO SER UNA MUJER EMPRENDEDORA, QUIEN AL TENER LA IDEA DE ESTE NEGOCIO, BUSCÓ LA MANERA DE HACERLO REALIDAD Y AHORA DEMONSTRADO SE RUNA IDEA RENTABLE. CON FIN DE MANTENER SU SERVICIO A LA COMUNIDAD Y EXPANDER SU NEGOCIO ALICIA BUSCA UN CREDITO DE 3000 SOLES CON KIVA Y EDPYME ALTERNATIVA.     CON EL CRÉDITO COMPRARÁ MAS MERCADERIA (HOJAS BOND, CUADERNES, PAPEL LUSTRE, CORRECTORES, LAMINAS, ETC) PARA SURTIR SU NEGOCIO Y SU RESPECTIVA VENTA. ATENDIENDO LA DEMANDA INSATISFECHA EN EL LUGAR,  AMPLIARÁ SU CARTERA DE CLIENTES, CONTANDO CON CLIENTES NUEVOS E INGRESOS ADICIONALES A LA FAMILIA.
texts.en: Alicia is 45 years old, she is single and she is well-known in her community for her stationer’s and bookshop activity. She lives with her mother, whom she cares for and supports; her mother helps her oust in the shop. Alicia can count on good personal references and on a close-knit family, and she lies in a community in the north of Peru where people engage in agriculture, animal breeding and retail. She has proven herself to be an enterprising woman: as soon as she got the idea for her activity she found a way to make it become real, and it has now proven to be a profitable idea. Alicia is asking Kiva and Edpyme Altenativa for a loan of 3000 PEN to in order to keep on providing her services to her community and to expand her activity. The loan she is requesting will be uses to buy products such as bond paper, notebooks, construction paper, correction fluids and prints to stock-up her activity and to sell them. By meeting the unsatisfied requests of her area she will gain more customers, and new customers will grant an additional income for her family.

loans.use: To buy bond paper, notebooks, construction paper, correction fluids and prints.

loans.name: Rosario Luz

texts.es:
Rosario tiene 30maños de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora ya que es madre soltera y con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio ha sacado adelante a su hija sola ya que el padre de su hija la abandono y desde ese momento se convirtió en padre y madre para ella, eso la lleno de mucha fuerza y valor y sobre todo muchas ganas de demostrar que podía y que no se iba a rendir. Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad e Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener atractivos turísticos como “Las Islas Ballestas y el candelabro de paracas”, quienes reciben a muchos turistas en todo el año, ya que son paisajes hermosos, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura y también la ganadería y la pesca. Cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho preparar postres y en especial le gusta preparar su platillo favorito el cual es el riquísimo “arroz con pollo”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos ella solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gusta mucho estudiar diseño de Modas.

Con mucho entusiasmo rosario trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, ella trabaja desde muy temprano para ofrecer sus productos en el mercado de su ciudad el cual es alquilado y por ello que trabaja muy duro ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puede mantener su hogar, diariamente puede atender hasta 30 clientes y ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo trabaja con muchas ganas.

Rosario está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio como blusas, pantalones, casacas, buzo, entre otros ya que se acerca la temporada de fiestas patrias, de esta manera ella mejorara sus ingresos y tendrá mas variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, así ella seguirá luchando con muchas ganas para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” construir su casa de material noble ya que actualmente es de madera y darle una profesión a  su hija”.
texts.en:
Rosario is 30 years old and is a woman who is a fighter and a single mother. With much strength and sacrifice she has advanced her daughter by herself because the father of her daughter abandoned her. From that moment on she converted into the father and mother of her daughter, which filled her with much strength and bravery, and above all, much desire to demonstrate that she could do it and that she would not surrender. Her home is located in the city of Pisco, a city that is characterized for having tourist attractions like the Ballesta Islands and the Paracas candlestick which receive many tourists all year round because they are beautiful sites. They also develop agriculture, livestock and fish. When she has free time she likes to prepare desserts and she especially likes to prepare her favorite dish which is rich chicken and rice. Due to her few economic resources, she could only study until the 5th grade in elementary school, but she would have liked to study fashion design. 

With a lot of enthusiasm, Rosaio works in her business selling clothes. Her work starts very early to offer her products in the market in the city in a rented space and she works very hard. With the fruit of her labor she can maintain her home. She assists up to 30 clients each day and she believes that her business goes well because she is friendly and above all she works with desire. 

Rosario is very grateful for the loans through Kiva. Thanks to the help they have given her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business like blouses, pants, jackets and track suits, among other items, close to the time of the patron festivals. This way, she will increase her earnings and will have a greater variety of products to offer her customers. This way, she can continue fighting with much desire to be able to accomplish her greatest dream: "to construct her home out of dignified materials, because currently it is made of wood, and to give a career to her daughter."

loans.use: to buy merchandise (blouses, pants, jackets, track suits, among others).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Verene

texts.en:
Verene is 27 years old. She has one child aged five who is enrolled in school. 

She will use the loan to buy more beans for resale. She plans to use the profits from the business to provide any necessities for her family.

loans.use: to buy more beans for resale.

loans.name: Octavia

texts.en: Octavia is 32 years old and she is getting married to a man who is working in government. She has four children. She has a kiosk in front of her home. This loan will help her to purchase additional supplies for her store including biscuits, oil, soap and rice. She lives with her family in the city and she hopes to open a big store in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies including biscuits, oil, soap and rice.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge es una persona sencilla proviene de una familia humilde, ya que por lo mismo tuvo que trabajar a muy temprana edad, termino el bachillerato, pudo ingresar a la universidad pero lo dejo por falta de recursos económico, que no contaba él ni su familia, por lo que solo se dedicó a trabajar y con el tiempo compro su camión con el que trabaja desde hace más de 4 años, el mismo es el que conduce  el camión, llevando carga que llega a la Aduana Nacional de Bolivia en Cochabamba. Es miembro activo del Sindicato de Transporte Urbano, quienes se dedican a sacar las mercancías de la Aduana, Jorge está casado con la señora Delia. Tienen a su cargo dos hijos que están en edad escolar. El crédito lo necesita para comprar ruedas para su camión ya que los que tiene están muy viejos y necesitan ser cambiados lo más pronto posible.
texts.en: Jorge is a simple man coming from a humble family, and for this reason he has had to start working form a very young age. He finished high school and was able to enter university, but he had to abandon his studies because neither he nor his family had the necessary financial resources. Given this fact, he started working. In time he succeeded in buying the truck he has been working with for more than 4 years as a driver, delivering cargo from the Bolivian National Customs Office in Cochabamba. He is an active member of the Urban Transportation Syndicate, whose job is to retrieve products from Customs. Jorge is married with Delia, and he has two children who go to school. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wheels for his truck, since the ones he has are very old and they need to be changed as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy new wheels for his truck.

loans.name: Luis Saul

texts.es:
Luis es un joven de 22 años de edad, el cual es muy trabajador y también muy optimista, vive al lado de su madre y su dos hermanos menores a quienes apoya mucho con el fruto de su trabajo ya que son de condición humilde, su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros, asimismo podemos encontrar playas hermosas y sobre todo sus pobladores son muy amables.  Luis trabaja desde muy joven, pero cuando termino sus estudios secundarios y al ver que a su madre no le alcanzaba los pocos ingresos que percibía, ingresos a trabajar en un fundo Agrícola, donde actualmente trabaja desde hace 4 años; él cree que le va bien en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y honesto y sobre todo que su mejor motivación es ayudar a su familia.

Luis está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda ya que es de adobe y quincha y con este apoyo el podrá comprar esteras y plástico para pode refaccionar su techo ya que en tiempo de lluvia y debido a los materiales de su vivienda el agua filtra por el techo y en ocasiones se inunda, así de esta manera el podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familia y podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño.” Estudiar una carrera y ser un profesión y darle una buena calidad de vida a su familia y darle estudios a su hermanitos”.
texts.en:
Luis is a young man of 22 years of age. He is very hard working and also very optimistic. He lives with his mother and two younger siblings. He supports them a lot with the fruit of his labors because they are of humble backgrounds. His home is located in the city of Imperial. This city is characterized for having a warm and friendly climate. It is developed by agriculture, especially the cultivation of cotton and corn, among others. We can also find beautiful beaches here and above all, its people are very amiable. 

Luis has worked since he was very young. When he finished his secondary schooling and upon seeing that his mother's earnings were not enough, he began to work on a farm where he now has worked for four years. He believes that his work is going well for him because he is very responsible and honest, and above all his greatest motivation is helping his family. 

Luis is very thankful for the Kiva lenders because thanks to the help that he is provided with he will be able to make improvements to his home. His home is made of adobe and reeds. With this support he will be able to buy reed panels and plastic so he can repair his roof. Because of the rainy season and as a result of the house's materials, water leaks through the roof and at times floods. In this way he will be able to improve his family's quality of life and continue working to make his largest dream come true: to study for a college degree, become a professional and give his family a better quality of life and his brothers an education.

loans.use: to improve his home (buying reed panels and plastic for his roof).

loans.name: Masudi

texts.en:
At 26 years of age, Masudi runs two businesses - selling clothes and farming. Both activities earn him profits for supporting his family. 

Masudi is currently requesting a Kiva loan that he'll use to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. His goal for the future is to successfully open a boutique. Masudi also aims to earn profits by running his business in a store that's well located and well served by his employees. He hopes to earn good profit so that he can continue providing for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Petronille

texts.en:
Petronille is 49 years old. She is a mother of seven children between the ages of five and twenty-five. She sells sorghum and beans and has been in this business for 7 years. 

She has requested a loan to buy more beans and sorghum for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more beans and sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Mkhitar

texts.en:
Mkhitar is 26 years old. He lives in Kechut village with his parents. Mkhitar and his father work at a local factory, but the salary they get is not enough to cover the household costs. So they are also involved in cattle breeding. Mkhitar wants to develop agriculture and turn it into a big farm in the future. 

To this aim, Mkhitar plans to increase the number of cattle by purchasing 2 cows and a calf. This will allow him to earn more income from the sales of meat and milk. Mkhitar dreams of starting his own family and sustaining them. With developed agriculture, he will make his dream come true and live with higher living standards.

loans.use: to pay for 2 cows and a calf.

location.town: Kechut village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Elkana

texts.en:
Elkana is 28 years old and is a boda boda (motorcycle) operator in Mombasa. He is single and has been in this business for the last 3 years. His business is doing great. 

This marks Elkana's third borrowing from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to buy another motorcycle. He hopes to become a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena is 38 years old. She is married and has six children; four of them are studying in school. Her husband is a farmer. She has a kiosk, so she is taking out this loan to purchase additional supplies for her store including rice, oil, noodles and cigarettes. She has been in business since 2005 starting with working capital of $100.00. She wants to have a big store and buy a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional supplies including rice, oil, noodles and cigarettes.

loans.name: Fernanda Leonela

texts.es:
Fernanda es una mujer de 25 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su pareja y su pequeña hija de 1 año de edad, ella es una persona muy amable, alegre y entusiasta que junto con su pareja, dedican todos sus esfuerzos para salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le hubiera gustado mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear con su pequeña por las acogedoras calles de la ciudad y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y producto de sus ahorros de trabajos anteriores, Fernanda pudo comprar una mototaxi, la cual alquila a otros choferes para que la trabajen y ella pueda obtener ingresos; adicionalmente ella también trabaja con su madre en su pequeño negocio de venta de pescados, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buena atención.
Fernanda se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general  de su mototaxi; de esta manera Fernanda contará con su vehículo en buenas condiciones para poder seguir alquilándolo y con ella espera poder incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para adquirir un auto y terminar la construcción de su vivienda, para así poder asegurar el bienestar y futuro de su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a 25-year-old woman who lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district with her partner and her little 1-year-old daughter. She is a very pleasant person, who is happy and enthusiastic. Fernanda and her partner dedicate all of their effort to get ahead in life. Unfortunately, because of the need to work since she was very young to help her parents and cover her living costs, Fernanda could not study for a professional career. However, she would have very much liked to do so. In her free time, Fernanda likes to go out with her child along the cozy city streets and sometimes she cooks a very delicious "carapulcra con sopa seca" (traditional Peruvian pork stew with noodles) to share with her family.  

Thanks to her effort and because of her savings from past jobs, Fernanda could buy a mototaxi, which she rents to other drivers so that they can use it and so that she can get income. Additionally, Fernanda also works with her mother in her small fish sales business. Fernanda feels pleased to be fulfilling her work and she believes that it is going well because of her good customer service.

Fernanda is very grateful to Kiva lenders, and now thanks to the offered support, she can provide general maintenance on her mototaxi. In this way, Fernanda will be able to count on the fact that her vehicle will be in good condition in order to continue renting it, and with that she hopes to be able to increase her income. In the near future Fernanda would like to use that income to get a car and finish the construction of her home, in order to be able to assure the well-being and future of her little daughter.

loans.use: to be able to provide general maintenance on her moto-taxi.

loans.name: Gertrudes

texts.en: Gertrudes is 47 years old and she is a widow. She has four children; all of them are in school. She has a restaurant and she will use this loan to buy meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to serve people in her restaurant. She started to do business in 1990 selling fried bananas only, but now she has her restaurant. She opened this restaurant in order to make money and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy meat, fish, chicken and vegetables to serve people in her restaurant.

loans.name: Le Chateau Group

texts.fr:
Mme Abzeta est la représentante du groupe LE CHATEAU. Abzeta va bien,elle est très contente de Micro Start et ses Partenaires du soutien qu'il accorde aux femmes.Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 24ans le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 de ses enfants vont a l’école et elle a 05 personnes à sa charge.

Mme vend des condiments (choux, piments, aubergines, poivron etc.). Elle exerce ce métier depuis 11ans. Elle a acheté les légumes et dit que ça marche bien. Avec les bénéfices du prêt, elle à ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.Elle s’approvisionne à Kombissiri village environnant. Ses clients sont les revendeurs, les femmes et hommes.

Mme veut  s’acheter 1sac de choux, 01 caisse de tomate, des aubergines et du piment.

Elle épargne ses bénéfices pour s’acquérir un motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille. Elle veut un nouveau prêt plus élévé pour mieux travailler et réaliser du bénéfice afin de s'acheter un motocycle.Mme ambitionne agrandir son commerce et épargner.

NB: sur la photo les 04 membres debout ne font plus parti du groupe. Il reste seulement les trois assises.
texts.en:
Abzeta is the representative of the Le Chateau group. She is doing well, and is very happy with Micro Start and its partners, and the support they give to women. She is married and is mother to seven children. The oldest of her children is 24, while the youngest is 4 years of age. Two of her children go to school, and she has five people under her care.

Abzeta sells condiments (cabbage, peppers, eggplant, sweet peppers, etc.), and has worked in this business for 11 years. She has bought her vegetables, and says that things are going well. With the profits from her loan she improved her family's living conditions. 

Abzeta gets her supplies in the nearby village of Kombissiri, and her customers are male and female resellers. She wants to buy one bag of cabbages, one box of tomatoes, eggplant and peppers. She saves her profits as she wants to buy a motorcycle, as well as to better provide for her family. She wants a new, larger loan so she can work better and make profits so she can buy a motorcycle. She plans to expand her business, as well as to save.

Note: in the photo the four people standing are no longer part of the group - only the three seated members remain part of the group.

loans.use: to buy one bag of cabbages, one box of tomatoes, eggplant and peppers.

loans.name: Régine

texts.fr: Régine est une jeune Camerounaise âgée de 34 ans, mariée et mère de 03 enfants parmi lesquels 02 vont à l'école.elle a en plus de ses enfants une autre personne à sa charge. elle a pour activité un salon de couture qu'elle gère depuis 05 ans et elle s'est spécialisée dans la couture des robes communément appelées "kabas". elle fait des expositions-vente et elle travaille également sur commande. ses années d'expérience lui ont permis d'avoir une clientèle considérable. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 04 rouleaux de tissus pour renforcer son stock de matière première et augmenter sa capacité productive afin de répondre aux demandes de sa clientèle dans les délais. elle a pour ambition d'agrandir son atelier de couture.
texts.en: Régine is a young woman from Cameroon, 34 years of age. She is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. In addition to her children, she has one other dependent. Her line of business is her sewing shop, which she has managed for five years. She specializes in sewing dresses known as “kabas” [a type of traditional outfits]. She sells ready-to-wear clothing and also takes orders. She would like to use this loan to buy four rolls of fabric to replenish her supply of materials and increase her production capacity in order to be able to meet customer demand on a timely basis. Her goal is to enlarge her sewing shop.

loans.use: to buy four rolls of fabric.

loans.name: Alex Wuilmer

texts.es:
Alex  tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, así como también por sus atractivos turísticos como “las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas. Vive al lado de su esposa y su madre ya que ella los ha apoyado con un espacio donde vivir. Con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación Alex trabaja como taxista desde hace 2 años, con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar con los gastos del hogar, el trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día y puede atender hasta 15 clientes diariamente; él cree que el va bien en su trabajo porque es muy luchador y sobre todo porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Alex está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la gran ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda como la colocación de un baño, ya que actualmente solo tiene una letrina y debido a ello su madre se enfermo debido a ello, de esta manera podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida para su familia, así el podrá seguir trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Darle una buena calidad de vida y sobre todo construir una vivienda para su madre”.
texts.en:
Alex is 35 years old. He lives in the city of Pisco, which is known for its warm and hospitable climate, as well as its tourist attractions like “Las Islas Ballestas” (The Ballestas Islands) and “El Candelabro de Paracas” (The Paracas Candelabra). He lives with his wife and mother, as they are supporting him with a place to live. With much enthusiasm and dedication, Alex has worked for 2 years as a taxi driver. From this work he is able to help out with the household expenses. He works around 9 hours per day and can have up to 15 customers daily; he believes that he is successful in his work because he is a fighter, and above all because he has a strong desire to get ahead. 

Alex is very grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the great help that they have offered, he can make improvements in his home, such as the addition of a bathroom. Currently, it only has one latrine, and his mother became ill because of this. He will be able to offer a better quality of life to his family, so he can continue working to make his greatest dream a reality: to give them a good quality of life and above all build a home for his mother.

loans.use: to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Hilber Edilberto

texts.es: El señor Hilber tiene 28 años de edad él vive en la provincia Carrasco a un kilómetro del Municipio de Chimore, de la ciudad de Cochabamba él se encuentra soltero no tiene dependientes,  Hilber Edilberto trabaja como afiliado en el sindicato 19 de abril. Hilber Edilberto  vivía en la misma Población hace como 20 años atrás él tuvo que sobre salir solo porque sus padres se fueron al exterior, él se volvió a levantar solo tomo un nuevo rumbo en su camino empezó de cero, ahora él tiene un lote Urbano y una movilidad y de esa manera él trabaja como chofer realizando en el sindicato 19 de abril.  El préstamo que solicita Hilber es para la compra de la movilidad y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos. Hilber sueña con un futuro mejor para el y su familia.
texts.en:
Hilber is 28, and lives in Carrasco province, one kilometer from the municipality of Chimore in the city of Cochabamba. He is single and has no dependents. 

Hilber Edilberto works as a member of the "19 de Abril" taxi collective.  Hilber Edilberto was living in the same town around 20 years years ago. He had to succeed on his own because his parents left the country. On his own, he got back on his feet again, and took a new path in life, beginning from nothing.  

Now he has a urban lot and a car, and works as taxi diver with the "19 de Abril" collective. The loan that Hilber is requesting is for the purchase of the car, enabling him to have more income. Hilber dreams about a better future for himself and his family.

loans.use: To buy a vehicle for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 52-year-old food stall owner in Mariakani. She is married. She has been operating the food kiosk for the past two years with great success. 

This is Mary’s fifth business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to renovate her kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables. 

She will use the anticipated profits to improve her business further. She hopes to excel in the business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to renovate her kiosk and purchase more chairs and tables

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is a 61-year-old resident of Tabuan, Tukuran. She provides her 8 children's needs from the little amount of 11,300 PHP she gains monthly from her own piggery business. She has had this business for 5 years as an aid to their daily needs. However since 2011 she's been a member of GDMPC, and she applied for a loan at GDMPC microfinance of 18,900 PHP to buy feeding supplies. Rosita wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to buy feeding supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase two sacks of rice, one box of pasta, and groundnut paste.

loans.name: Abduvaqqos

texts.en:
Abduvaqqos is a man who likes work very much. He has a lovely wife and 3 little children and tries to do the best for them. He is very clever and smart.  His skills help him to be the best in all deals. 

Abduvaqqos has had his own business for more than 4 years. He has a shop in the centre of his town. He has been busy selling food products such as candies, biscuits, chocolates and other products. He has many customers because he has a wide assortment of goods. His wife helps him with the business. Abduvaqqos is asking for a loan to buy goods to develop his business. He promises to pay the loan in time. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy candies, biscuits, and chocolates to develop his business.

loans.name: Roukeyatou

texts.fr: Revendeuse de sachet et des produits génériques depuis 09ans au marché, Madame Roukeyatou est maman de 02 adorables enfants (22 et 16ans) dont 01 scolarisé. Elle est âgée de 40ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et voudrait être le leader dans la vente des produits génériques et des sachets. Dans l’avenir, elle veut  augmenter son stock et assurer le bien- être de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of sachets and generic goods at the market for nine years, Mrs. Roukeyatou is the mother of two lovely children (22 and 16 years old), one of whom attends school. Mrs. Roukeyatou is 40 years old. She gets her supplies in Lomé and would like to be the leading seller of generic goods and sachets. In the future, she wants to increase her stock and see to the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase generic goods and sachets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase chicks and livestock feed, in order to resell them.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella of Panduma, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, has been selling a variety of different vegetables, spices and more for more than five years. She earns 12,570 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She’s 50 years old now, yet continues to hang on to her retail business to give adequate support to her four children. She's a new member of GDMPC. In order to enhance her store, Stella borrowed 25,000 PHP from GDMPC [Kiva's Field Partner] to obtain more vegetables and spices to sell. Stella hopes that someday her children will be successful in their careers.

loans.use: to obtain more vegetables and spices to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 months to 12 years. She describes herself as a determined woman. She operates a farm and sells maize and wheat. She has been involved in this business for 13 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of wheat and maize seeds. She will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy maize seeds for planting. Her business goal is to venture into a wholesale cereal retail business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds for sowing.

loans.name: Khadidiatou

texts.fr: 	Mme khadidiatou est à environ 1 km de l’Institution, veuve elle s’occupe bien de ses enfants, elle se tut au travail rien que pour satisfaire leurs besoins. Depuis quelques années elle s’active dans  le commerce, elle achète des  perles, des filets à pêcher pour confectionner des chaussures pour ensuite les revendre, elle va en plus de l’huile de palme venant de diaobé. Mme Khadidiatou  est à son 3 prêt et elle a toujours respecté ses engagements  de ce fait elle demande un crédit de 200 000 f. Elle vend les chaussures  à 15 000 l’unité. Les bénéfices générés lui permettront d’épargner et mieux s’occuper de ses enfants. Mme Khadiatou a pour  ambition. d’augmenter son capital
texts.en:
Mrs. Khadidiatou is about one kilometer from the [lending] institution, and is a widow who takes good care of her children, working herself to death just to meet their needs. For several years, she has been participating in business: she purchases beads and fishing line to design and make shoes, which she then sells. She also [sells] palm oil that comes from Diaobé.

Mrs. Khadidiatou is on her third loan and she has always kept her commitments, so she is asking for a loan of 200,000 francs. She sells her shoes for 15,000 francs per pair. The profits generated will allow her to save and to better care for her children. Mrs. Khadidatou's goal is to increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase beads, fishing line, and incidentals for designing and making shoes and selling them afterward.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 33 years old. She is married with two children. She lives in Alindahaw, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. Virginia is a retailer of various ready-made or RTW products like lotion, perfumes and more. Every month she earns PHP 8,000. In 2011, Virginia joined GDMPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 15,000 to procure more items such as soaps, shampoo, lipstick, etc. She expects to gain more revenue to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to procure more items such as soaps, shampoo, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a single woman. She describes herself as a faithful woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be stiff competition within the area. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have opened a restaurant with the profits generated.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell.

loans.name: Berlista

texts.en: Berlista is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. She has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. Berlista became a member of HSPFI in 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 41 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Stella has been working hard to manage her bar where she sells beer, soda, and water. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more soda and local beer and will help Stella to generate greater profits and increase the family income. Stella hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her bar. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more soda and local beer

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en: Marcela is a 61 years old and married with two children living in Tabuan, Tukuran. In order to add income in the family, Marcela started a buy and sell of vegetable business two years ago. She usually gets 10,000 PHP per month. With the help of GDMPC microcredit, Marcela was able to buy more vegetables to sell because of the 15,000 PHP lent to her. Marcela joined GDMPC in 2010. Someday, she’s hoping for much greater revenue for business expansion.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.
 
Rosalinda is selling barbeque in the local community. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make barbeque like spices and meat.

Rosalinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosalinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make barbeque

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Marlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying & selling dried fish. Marlyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Marlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has eight children, four of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Alice has been working hard to manage her grocery store where she sells sugar, rice, pasho, Pampers, and other general goods. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cooking oil, sugar, eggs and other foodstuffs and will help Alice to generate greater profits, improve family income and increase capital investment. Alice hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger shop. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar, eggs and other foodstuffs

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La Sra. Eugenia es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es separada y comenta que tiene un hospedaje donde recibe a todas las personas que deseen tener un buen descanso.
Ella se dedica a este trabajo desde hace 15 años por lo que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre se acerca hasta su hospedaje.
Solicita el crédito para la refacción de unas habitaciones que necesitan ser arregladas, para que de esa forma pueda seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eugenia is from the city of Curuguaty.  She is separated and comments that she has a hotel where she receives all people who want to have a good rest. 

She has been making her living in this way for 15 years because she has good customers who always come to her hotel.

She is requesting a loan to renovate some of the rooms that need fixing so that she will be able to continue giving her customers good service.

loans.use: to renovate rooms in her hotel

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver lives in Libertad, Tukuran. He has earned an income through providing transportation services for even years to support the needs of his four children. He gets an income of 5,520 PHP a month from this business. For a 35-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Oliver is borrowing 7,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business. He joined GDMPC in 2010. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the transport vehicle used in his business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married and a mother. She is 63 years old. Her children are all grown up, but she supports three of her grandchildren. She sells and distributes water to her neighborhoods. Her monthly income amounts to KES 6,000 

Jane has been in this business for five years now.This is her second loan with KADET LTD. With this loan, she plans to buy a water tank so that she can store more water for sale and hence get better profits.

Any additional income will enable her to keep her grandchildren in school.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is forty five years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by being a seedling grower in the Philippines. Mercidita is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to purchase more tree seeds to sell.

Mercidita has been a seedling grower for 15 years and also earns additional income from selling sound systems and plastic wares.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more tree seeds to sell

loans.name: Zita

texts.en:
Zita is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of four children ages 17, 15, 13 and 7 years old. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Zita has been in the business of buying and selling charcoal and firewood for more than ten years now. This provides her the income that she needs for the family sustenance and the expenses for her children's schooling.

Zita is applying for a loan worth 4000 PHP to buy additional stock such as charcoal, firewood and for educational supplies for her children. She believes that if she is provided financial support for her business, it would for sure become more profitable. With the income, Zita can make other investments to augment her income so that she will become more capable of sending her children to school for better education and training.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as charcoal, firewood and for educational supplies for her children

loans.name: Aurora Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Aurora, reside en el departamento de Masaya, casada, tiene la edad de 59 años, su núcleo familiar  compuesto por 4 hijas y su esposo, gracias al esfuerzo obtenido entre ella y su esposo,  sacaron  adelante a sus hijas de tal manera que ya son independiente, y  del cual se siente orgullosa porque siente que su trabajo como comerciante ha sido provechoso y ha sacado frutos. Actualmente ella siempre sigue haciendo lo que mas le gusta y seguirá hasta que Dios le de fuerza y vida. Su negocio consiste en compra y venta de calzado,  tanto para damas como caballeros,  entre los mencionados están deportivos, colegiales, caite típico, sandalias para damas, rinos, entre otros. Sus puntos de ventas están ubicados en los mercados y tiendas de Jinotepe, Tipi tapa, Masa tepe, Granada, y la Concepción Masaya, gracias a la experiencia que ha tenido desde hace 25 años, ella se ha dado a conocer con sus clientes y con el tiempo  va logrando tener  más,  porque  han observado que el calzado es de buena calidad. Y por consiguiente no dejan de comprarles su producto. Se presenta a nuestra oficina Ceprodel para adquirir un crédito que le permita realizar las compras que necesita ya que esta teniendo varios pedido por la temporada de colegio, por lo que se acercan las fiestas patrias, de tal manera que le permitirá cumplir con todo el pedido.
texts.en:
Aurora is 59, married, and lives in Masaya department.  Her immediate family is made up of four daughters and her husband. Thanks to the efforts of her and her husband, they have raised their daughters in such a way that they are already independent. She is proud of this, because she feels that her work as a business owner has been beneficial and fruitful.

Currently she is still doing what she likes best, and will continue to do so as long as God gives her life and strength. Her business is buying and selling footwear, for both women and men. These include sport and school shoes, traditional leather sandals, women's sandals, Rhino shoes and other types of footwear. 

The places where she sells are located in markets and stores in Jinotepe, Tipitapa, Masatepe, Granada, and La Concepción, Masaya. 

Thanks to her 25 years experience she has made a name for herself among her customers. With time she is gradually succeeding in getting more customers, because they have seen that the footwear is of good quality, and consequently they continue to buy her product.  

She is coming to the Ceprodel office to get a loan that will allow her to make the purchases she needs, and enable her to fulfill all her orders. She is getting several orders for the school season, and because the national holidays are approaching.

loans.use: To buy boy's school shoes, women's shoes, flip-flops, plastic sandals, flats, traditional leather sandals.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a 32-year-old retail shop proprietor from Bamburi, Mombasa. He is married and has been doing his business for the past eight years with great success. He also does landscaping to supplement his income.

Stephen is a client oft KADET Ltd and this marks his third loan to finance his business. He plans to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders for his shop. He will use the anticipated profits to repay his loan and for the gradual expansion of his shop. He hopes to develop his retail shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase stock of cooking oil, rice, baking flour, maize flour and washing powders

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 38 years old and a mother of three children between 7 and 15 years old.

She is a tailor and has been doing this job for 10 years now. Monica gets a monthly income of KES 5,000.

With this loan, she intends to buy another sewing machine so that she can be able to work efficiently.

Any additional income will enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine.

loans.name: Allen

texts.en:
Allen is 36 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, Allen has been working hard to manage her stationary shop, where she makes photocopies and sells stationary. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more blank books, exercise books, files, and reams of paper and will help Allen to generate greater profits from the business by buying and purchasing in large quantities. Allen hopes that in the future, she will be able to operate a wholesale stationary store and bookshop. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more blank books, exercise books, files, and reams of paper

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline used her previous loan well by buying more drugs for sale and the business is doing good. She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after repaying the previous loan successfully. Caroline will use the loan to buy more stock of assorted drugs for her shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand the business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for her business

loans.name: Marina Esther

texts.es: Marina de 56 años de edad invirtió su credikiva en la compra de víveres y ropa, calzado salsas y encurtidos, con los cuales produjo nuevas ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva para invertir sobre los pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho y ella siempre responsable quiere ser oportuna con ellos. Con su nuevo credikiva comprará toallas, ropa interior ropa de cama y calzado. El éxito de su credikiva radica en que aumenta su capital de trabajo, el número de sus clientes y en la rotación rápida de su mercancia. Ella está muy satisfecha con su inversion y hoy envía el siguiente mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva” Muchas gracias por el apoyo financiero a microempresas colombianas y que sigan multiplicando esta excelente obra en todos los países del mundo. “
texts.en: Marina, who is 56 years old, invested her Kiva loan in the purchase of supplies and clothes, footwear, salsas, and pickles, with which she made new profits. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan in order to invest in the requests that her customers have made, and as she is always responsible, she wants to be timely with them. With her new Kiva loan she will buy towels, underclothes, bed linens, and footwear. The success of her loan lies in her increasing her work capital, the number of customers, and in the quick rotation of her merchandise. She is very satisfied with her investment and today sends the following message to the Kiva lenders: "Many thanks for the financial support to Colombian microenterprises and keep multiplying this excellent work in all the countries of the world."

loans.use: to buy towels, underclothes, bed linens, and footwear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more ladies accessories and posters to resell

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 20 to 30 years. She describes herself to be a creative woman. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, flour, salt, margarine, royce etc . Her business is located  in a busy business environment and her primary customers are local residents . She describes her biggest business challenges to be the shortage of household items and meeting the high demand of customers for household items. She will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more household items for resale. She had requested a loan of KES 50,000, which she repaid succesfully.  Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have created job opportunities for people.

loans.use: to buy more household items for resale

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is 45 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda.  She is married and has 2 children.  One attends school.  

For the past 7 years, Mariana has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells saucepans, juice, cosmetics, rice and other goods. 

To help expand her business, Mariana has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy rice, posho, biscuits and other goods to sell, and will help Mariana generate greater profits.

Mariana hopes that in the future she will be able to set up a very good and well stocked supermarket and add a wholesale business. 

Mariana is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves entrepreneurs like Mariana who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: buy more rice, posho, biscuits and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 60 years old.  She is married to John and they have four children.  She is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is her third loan in KADET LTD.  Jecinta paid her previous loan well and in good time.  She will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow to increase milk production.

Jecinta hopes to purchase more cows to add her milk production.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Amie Leslie

texts.en:
Amie Leslie is from Sto. Niño, Tukuran.  She is 30 years old, married and has one child. 

To make a living, Amie Leslie operates a computer business where she offers encoding, printing and access to online gaming.   She's been in business for two years and earns 13,500 PHP a month. 

Amie Leslie is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP, to buy more computers.  In 2011, Amie Leslie joined GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more computers.

loans.name: Kurusum

texts.en:
Kurusum is 35 years old and lives in the town of Mubende, in Uganda.  She is married and has 4 children; 3 of them are currently in school.  For the past 5 years, Kurusum has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells home consumption goods. 

To help expand her business, Kurusum has requested a loan of 2500000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more inventory like cooking oil, toilet paper, and soap to sell, and will help Kurusum generate greater profits, pay school fees and help construct her rental house.  Kurusum hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a restaurant. 

Kurusum is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kurusum who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: buy more inventory like cooking oil, toilet paper, and soap to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco Jose de  52 años de edad, de la localidad de chinandega , casada, con tres hijos mayores de edad, tiene por actividad economica la venta de comida y cerdos,el cual lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el objectivo del prestamos es mejorar los ingresos del hogar  y sacar adelante a mi hijo, el cual lo aprendio de su familia que tiene un ingresos similar el objectivo del prestamo es la compra de cerdos en pie para la comercializacion de sus productos como: carne de cerdo, adobado,chicharron, charrasca, chingaste, moronga, entre otros.
texts.en: Fracisco Jose is 52 years old and from the town of Chinandega. He is married with three adult children. He earns his living selling food and pigs from his own house. His is asking for a loan to improve his household income and to help his child, who has a similar income. With the loan he hopes to buy live pigs for his business and to make products such as pigs’ meat, pickled pork, pork rind, pork skin, pork bits and black pudding amongst others.

loans.use: to buy live pigs for his business and to make products such as pigs’ meat, pickled pork, pork rind, pork skin, pork bits and black pudding amongst others.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married and the mother of three dependents. She is 30 years old and lives in Sto. Niño, Tukuran. Helen owns and operates a tricycle transport business. She established the business as a way of generating extra income of 3,600 Philippine pesos (PHP) per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for two years. 

Helen requested a loan of 6,800 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase tricycle spare parts and accessories. Helen been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Helen wants to purchase motorcycles as another way to transport in her business.

loans.use: to purchase tricycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 32 years old, married to Eddah and blessed with two children ages eight and two years, respectively. 

He runs a retail shop that he started four years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 20,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase washing detergents, bathing and bar soaps, cooking oil and bales of baking flour to restock his shop.  He plans to use the anticipated profits to pay fees for his children.

His dream is to one day own a supermarket.

loans.use: to purchase washing detergents, bathing and bar soaps, cooking oil and bales of baking flour.

loans.name: Sanobarkhon

texts.en: Sanobarkhon is a hardworking woman with a high (education) degree. She has been working at a pharmacy for more than 10 years. She is one of the best workers and knows her job very well. She is a woman who finds new ways to get income. She took a course called ‘[How] to get success’ and learnt about organizing a new business. Now, she is going to start her own business selling different kinds of herbs and medicines. Her pharmacy will be situated in the centre of her town. She will be a successful business woman as she has good doctor (medical) as well as business skills. She is divorced and is raising her little daughter alone. She is asking for a loan to buy goods for her new business. She promises to repay the credit on time. She needs your help and awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of herbs and medicines

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be diligent. She operates a tailoring retail store where she sells school uniforms. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be competition within the area. She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy fabric for making school uniforms for sale. Her business goal is to improve her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to purchase another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Livio Juan

texts.es:
Livio es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive al lado de su esposa con la cual tiene 3 hijos, por los cuales trabaja mucho para darle una vida digna y sobre todo sean mejores que el. Su vivienda se ubica en Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, tiene playas hermosas y también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son muy alegres y son muy conocidos por su gran don en la preparación de platillos ya que cocinas riquísimo. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre a Livio le gusta pasear con su familia y sobre todo le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es la riquísima “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos él solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Livio trabaja en una granja, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día, trabajando como operario, es muy responsable y sobre todo honrado por ello el cree que le va bien en su trabajo, porque sus jefes están contentos con su trabajo.

Livio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, el comprara esteras, caña de Guayaquil, puerta, entre otros, para realizar refacciones en su techo y cambiar la puertas, de esta manera el podrá darle una mejor calidad de vida y podrá seguir trabajando y luchando por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:”  Construir su vivienda de material noble y darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Livio is a young man of 25 years of age. He lives with his wife who whom he has three children. He works very hard for them to give them a decent life and above all so that they can be better than him. His home is located in Chincha, a city that is known for a warm and welcoming atmosphere.  It has beautiful beaches and is also the home to great Peruvian sports glories. Its residents are also very happy and are well-known for preparing delicious dishes. 

When he has spare time, Livio likes to travel with his family and above all he likes to eat one of his favorite dishes which is the delicious “Carapulcra con sopa seca”. Due to lack of economic resources, he was only able to study through fifth grade in secondary school, but he would like to have attended college. Every day Livio works on a farm for approximately 10 hours a day as a laborer.  He is very responsible and above all he is very honest which is why he believes he does well at this job because his employers are happy with his work.  

Livio is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to the loans he will be able to make improvements in his home. He will buy mats, Guayaquil cane, and a door among other things in order to fix his roof and change the doors in his home.  In this way he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working and fighting to accomplish his greatest dream: “To build his home with good materials and give his children a good education.”

loans.use: to purchase mats and Guayaquil cane.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr:
	Mme Ramatoulaye âgée de  40 ans habite dans la ville principale, mariée et mère de famille elle est couturière de profession. Mais depuis 2 ans elle évolue dans le commerce, elle a louée une cantine où elle vend des produits de mercerie. Mme Ramatoulaye travaille de 10 h à 19 h et elle sollicite pour la quatrième fois un prêt de 75000. Ce prêt lui permettra  d’acheter plus de produits ce qui signifie pour elle plus de bénéfices.
                Mme Ramatoulaye a pour projet future le renforcement de son capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ramatoulaye, 40 years of age, lives in the capital. She is married with children. She is a seamstress by trade. However, for two years ago she has been working in commerce. She rents a shop where she sells sewing accessories. Mrs. Ramatoulaye works from 10 AM to 7 PM. She is seeking her fourth loan in the amount of 75,000 [West African francs]. This loan will allow her to buy more products, which means higher revenues for her.
Her future goal is to bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies in order to restock her shop and increase her revenues.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma works hard in order to support her family.  Thelma has 2 children who are in school. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for nine years.  Thelma has requested a loan of 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

In the future, Thelma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Nelly Del Pilar

texts.es:
Nelly tiene 42 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, la cual se caracteriza por su clima cálido y acogedor, así como también por sus atractivos turísticos como “las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas”, también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de algodón, maíz, frejol, entre otros. Junto a ella vive su esposo con el cual tiene un hijo de 13 años de edad, por el cual trabaja mucho ya que lo ama muchísimo y por quien daría la vida con tal de darle una vida feliz. Cuando dispone d  un tiempo libre le gusta mucho tejer chompas y también le encanta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a los pocos recursos económicos solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Nelly trabaja en su negocio de venta de abarrotes, verduras, bebidas gaseosas, cervezas, entre otros, ella trabaja en su negocio alrededor de 10 horas diarias y puede atender hasta 25 clientes diariamente; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque ofrece buenos productos.

Nelly está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mostradores para su negocio y también comprar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, fideos al por mayor, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá tener mayor variedad de productos  y podrá exhibirlos de mejor manera, así seguirá mejorando sus ingresos y también podrá seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y poder mejorar su calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Nelly is 42 years old and lives in the city of Pisco which is characterised by its warm welcoming climate and by its tourist attractions such as the Ballestas Islands and the Paracas Candelabra. It is also an agricultural city which specialises in the cultivation of cotton, corn and beans. 
She live with her husband and son of 13 years of age, for whom she works very hard since she loves him very much and for whom she would give her life for him to have a happy life. When she has free time she likes to knit jumpers and also to eat her favourite dish which is Chilli Chicken. Due to her a lack of financial resources she only finished her high school education, but she would have liked very much to study at university. 

Every day Nelly works in her business selling items such as groceries, vegetables, soft drinks, beers. She works in her business for around 10 hours every day and can have up to 25 customers a day. She believes her business is going well because she is very friendly with the customers and above all offers good products. 

Nelly is very grateful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their help she will be able to buy counters for her business as well as wholesale merchandise  such as rice, sugar and pasta. In this way she will be able to increase the variety of her produce and also continue fighting to make her greatest dream come true, to provide her son with a profession and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 28 years old, married, and blessed with a three-year-old child. She owns a shop, a business she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES. 10,000. 

She has requested her first loan worth KES.20,000 to purchase two bales of maize flour, sachets of Royco (brand of instant soup), and ready-to-drink juices for sale. 

The anticipated profit will aid her to educate her child. Her dream is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To purchase two bales of maize flour, sachets of Royco, and ready to drink juices.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 31 years old and she is married.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines.  She has been cultivating vegetables for three years now.  She has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past and, more recently, she has borrowed from Kiva to sustain her farming business.  At present, Evelyn has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yra Jhoselyn

texts.es:
Yra tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, tiene atractivos turísticos los cuales son visitados por muchos turistas en todo el año como “las Islas Ballestas y el Candelabro de Paracas”. Cuando tiene un tiempo libre a Yra le gusta mucho comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos Yra solo tuvo estudios secundarios, pero le hubiera gustado mucho estudiar la carrera de Enfermería.

Día a día Yra trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza y abarrotes, ella trabaja alrededor de 9 horas al día, con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su hogar por ello trabaja con mucho entusiasmo, por ello cree que le va bien en su negocio porque le gusta su trabajo y porque es mable con los clientes.

Yra está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comparar mercadería para su negocio como arroz, azúcar, atún, conservas, entre otros; de esta manera ella podrá mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera poder ofrecer más variedad de productos para sus clientes, así ella seguirá trabajando y luchando para  poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un local propio para su negocio y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yra, 41, lives in the city of Pisco which is a city known for a warm and welcoming atmosphere. It has tourist attractions which are visited by tourists year round such as the Ballestas Islands and the Candelabro de Paracas.  When she has free time, Yra likes to eat one of her favorite dishes which is the delicious “Aji de Gallina”. Due to lack of economic resources, Yra was only able to attend secondary school, but she would have liked to study Nursing. 

Every day, Yra works in her small business selling beauty and grocery products.  She works approximately nine hours a day.  With the fruits of her labor, she can cover the costs of her household expenses.  She believes she does well at her business because she likes her work and because she is friendly with her clients. 

Yra is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to the loans, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, sugar, tuna, and canned goods among other things. In this way she will be able to improve her income by offering more variety of products to her customers.  She will continue to work and fighting to accomplish her greatest dream: “To have a proper location for her business and to have her own home.”

loans.use: to buy merchandise (rice, sugar, tuna, and canned goods among other things)

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmin is a married woman with four children. She has been engaged in the business of livestock for eight years. She sells milk and desi ghee (clarified butter). 

By making extra effort, she makes yogurt from the extra milk and extracts desi ghee from it. This gives her more monetary benefit as compared to selling milk. She efficiently manages her expenses with sales of milk and desi ghee.  Her husband also assists her in looking after her cattle. 

Yasmin is providing education to all her children. She always wants to give better food, basic necessities and education to her children.

To make better conditions for her household, she desires to enhance her business by buying one more buffalo. For raising money, she came to know about Kashf Foundation. Kashf Foundation has scrutinized her business condition and after gauging her motivation and hard work, approved a loan amount of Rs. 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo.

loans.name: Iqbal

texts.en:
Ms. Iqbal is a married woman. She has six children. Her eldest daughter helped her in her business after completing her education, and her remaining five children are getting education in different classes. Her aim is to provide education to all her children.

She has been doing the business of thread rolls for the last seven years. She currently has one thread-winding machine. 

She has established good contacts in the market and has good orders in her hand. Due to her good reputation in the market, she has a chance to improve her business. She has requested Kashf Foundation to provide a loan of Rs. 45,000, so she can buy another thread-winding machine and expand her business. 

She is very positive about the growth of her business and has a motive to provide good living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to buy a thread-winding machine.

loans.name: Jonatann Jesus

texts.es:
Jonatann es un joven de 25 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Chincha, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, tiene playas hermosas y también es la cuna de grandes glorias del deporte peruano, asimismo sus pobladores son muy alegres y son muy conocidos por su gran don en la preparación de platillos ya que cocinan riquísimo. Cuando Jonatann tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho salir a pasear con su hijo de 1 año de edad, el está separado de la madre de su hijo, pero a pesar de ello se esfuerza muy duro para poder darle una vida digna. 

Con mucho entusiasmo Jonatann trabaja como técnico en un centro educativo de su ciudad, el trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día, principalmente porque se encarga de el sistema de computo, el cree que el va bien en su trabajo porque lo hace con muchas ganas y sobre todo porque es responsable y honrado.

Jonatann está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias al gran apoyo que le han brindado el podrá realizar los trámites para poder comprar un pequeño terreno para poder tener un lugar donde construir su casa, de esta manera podrá seguir luchando y trabajando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño: “Darle una buena educación a su hijo y una buena calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jonatann is a young man of 25 years of age. He lives in the city of Chincha, which is characterised by its warm and welcoming climate. It has beautiful beaches and is the home of many of the great stars of Peruvian sport. For this reason its inhabitants are very happy and are they are also well known for their excellent culinary skills since the local food is delicious. When Jonatann has free time her likes to go for a walk with his one-year-old child. He is separated from the mother of his son, but despite this he works very hard to be able to give him a good life.

With great enthusiasm Jonatann works as a technician in an educational centre in his city. He works around 8 hours per day, and is mainly in charge of the computer system. He believes his work is going very well for him since he does it with great enthusiasm and above all because he is responsible and honourable. 

Jonatann is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since thanks to their support he has been able to comply with the legal requirements to buy a small piece of land where he can build his house and in this way continue fighting and working to make his greatest dream come true - to give his son a good education and a good quality of life.

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.fr: Samuel est un jeune homme de 33 ans,marié,père de 02 enfants dont l'âge est compris entre 02 et 04 ans.
